<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='30',FILE='C:\JMS\ssenthi\08-16762-3\task3012854\16762-3-ba-07.htm',USER='105271',CD='Jul  1 01:02 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 7:&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Management&#146;s
Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations<a name="Item7ManagementsDiscussionAndAnal_220829"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Overview</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April&nbsp;10, 2008,
Frontier Holdings, Frontier Airlines, and Lynx (collectively, the &#147;Debtors&#148;)
filed voluntary petitions for relief under Chapter 11 of the Bankruptcy Code in
the Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of New York.&#160; The Debtors&#146; cases are being jointly
administered under Case No.&nbsp;08-11298 (RDD).&#160; The Debtors will continue to operate their
businesses as &#147;debtors-in-possession&#148; under the jurisdiction of the Bankruptcy
Court and in accordance with the applicable provisions of the Bankruptcy Code
and orders of the Bankruptcy Court.&#160; In
several recent bankruptcies in our industry, however, the airline ceased
operations, and we can give no assurance that we will be able to continue to
operate our business or successfully reorganize.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our Chapter 11 filings followed an unexpected attempt
by our principal credit card processor to substantially increase a &#147;holdback&#148;
of customer receipts from the sale of tickets.&#160;
This change in established practices would have represented a material
negative change to our cash forecasts and business plan, put severe restraints
on our liquidity and made it impossible for us to continue normal
operations.&#160; Due to historically high
aircraft fuel prices, continued low passenger mile yields, cash holdbacks
instituted by our other credit card processor, and the threatened new holdback,
we determined that we could not continue to operate without the protections
provided by Chapter&nbsp;11.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the
year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, we had a net loss of $60,253,000 or $1.64 per
diluted share, as compared to a net loss of $20,370,000 or 56&#162; per diluted
share for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007. Included in our net loss for the
year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 were the following items (i)&nbsp;a decrease in
fuel expense for non-cash mark to market derivative gains of $1,847,000 and
realized cash settlements of $30,740,000 on fuel hedging contracts; (ii)&nbsp;a
post-retirement liability curtailment gain of $6,361,000; (iii)&nbsp;$8,454,000
of start-up costs for Lynx Aviation; (iv)&nbsp;$3,339,000 in accelerated
depreciation for our seat replacement project; (v)&nbsp;$1,791,000 in net
losses on sales of assets; and (vi)&nbsp;$442,000 in employee separation
cost.&#160; Included in our net loss for the
year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 were the following items: (i)&nbsp;a decrease in
fuel expense for non-cash mark to market derivative gains of $12,753,000 and an
increase in fuel expense of $3,925,000 paid to counter-party for fuel hedge
settlements; (ii)&nbsp;$656,000 in gains on Boeing parts held for sale (iii)&nbsp;$3,139,000
of start-up costs for Lynx Aviation; and (iv)&nbsp;a tax valuation allowance of
$3,980,000.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We increased passenger revenue by 17.4% in
the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, over the prior year which is a result of
increasing our capacity (as measured by ASM&#146;s) by 12.0% while increasing our
passenger yields by 4.5%.&#160; The increase
in our passenger revenue can be primarily attributed to the increase in our
load factor year-over-year by 4.9 points and an increase of our average fare
from $102.59 to $103.71 or 1.1%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have relatively low operating expenses
excluding fuel because we currently operate a single fleet of aircraft on our
mainline routes in a single class of service with high aircraft utilization
rates.&#160; Our mainline CASM, or cost per
available seat mile, for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007 was 9.90&#162;
and 9.46&#162;, respectively, an increase of 4.7%.&#160;
The increase in mainline CASM was largely due to an increase in fuel
expense to 3.53&#162; per ASM from 3.03&#162; per ASM for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2008 and 2007, respectively, an increase of 16.5%.&#160; Mainline CASM excluding fuel was 6.37&#162; per
ASM as compared to 6.43&#162; per ASM for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007,
respectively, a decrease of 0.9%.&#160; This
decrease in mainline CASM excluding fuel is partially due a one-time gain on a
curtailment of a pension plan of $6,361,000, or 0.05&#162; per ASM, and lower
aircraft lease expense per ASM, or a reduction of 0.07&#162; per ASM over prior
year, primarily as a result of an increase in utilization rates of our fleet.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Despite our
improvements in passenger yields and decrease in mainline CASM excluding fuel,
historically high aircraft fuel prices continue to have a material adverse
effect on our financial performance.&#160; Our
losses over the past three years have been primarily driven by rising fuel
costs and our inability to pass these increases on to our customers due to a
highly competitive market.&#160; We have seen
a sharp rise in fuel costs since January&nbsp;2005, and fuel costs may continue
to increase or remain at these historically high levels.&#160; Our average fuel cost per gallon, including
hedging activities, was $2.45 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 compared
to $2.12 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007, an increase of 15.6%.&#160; Since March&nbsp;31, 2008, our aircraft fuel
expense has increased by approximately 60% excluding the benefits of hedging,
which would have equated to an estimated&#160;
$325,000,000 increase in fuel expense on an annualized basis to our March&nbsp;31,
2008 results.&#160; Additionally, we continue
to operate in a highly competitive pricing environment, which limits our
ability to increase fares to offset high fuel costs.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">31</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='31',FILE='C:\JMS\ssenthi\08-16762-3\task3012854\16762-3-ba-07.htm',USER='105271',CD='Jul  1 01:02 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of April&nbsp;10, 2008
(the date we filed for relief under the Bankruptcy Code), we had in excess of
$108 million in unrestricted cash, cash equivalents and short-term investments.
Our ability, both during and after the Chapter 11 case, to continue as a
going-concern is dependent upon, among other things, our ability (i)&nbsp;to
successfully achieve required cost savings to complete our restructuring; (ii)&nbsp;to
maintain adequate liquidity; (iii)&nbsp;to generate cash from operations; (iv)&nbsp;to
secure financing; (v)&nbsp;to negotiate favorable terms with our bankcard
processors and credit card companies;&#160; (vi)&nbsp;to
confirm a plan of reorganization under the Bankruptcy Code; and (vii)&nbsp;to
achieve profitability. Uncertainty as to the outcome of these factors raises
substantial doubt about our ability to continue as a going-concern. The
accompanying consolidated financial statements do not include any adjustments
that might result should we be unable to continue as a going-concern. A plan of
reorganization could materially change the amounts currently disclosed in the
consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our Business Plan</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of the continuing
drastic escalation in fuel costs and our Chapter 11 proceeding, we are
continuing an aggressive examination of many aspects of our business.&#160; We are implementing a comprehensive
restructuring effort to achieve cost competitiveness by attempting to obtain
economic concessions from key stakeholders, such as employees and vendors, in
order to allow us to reduce costs, create financial flexibility and restore its
long-term viability and profitability.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our evaluation has encompassed our network, cost
structure, fleet composition, both mainline and regional, and balance sheet.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Network Adjustments</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In November&nbsp;2007, we announced our plan to
reinforce capacity to our top destinations to support the start-up of Lynx
Aviation by closing unprofitable routes and increasing frequencies and capacity
in several markets served through our hub at DIA.&#160; In January&nbsp;2008, we discontinued service
to Mexico from several of our non-hub markets, discontinued service to
Guadalajara, Mexico from DIA, and discontinued service from Memphis, Tennessee
to Ft. Lauderdale and Orlando, Florida, and Las Vegas, Nevada.&#160; In April&nbsp;2008, we discontinued service
to Baton Rouge, Louisiana, Palm Beach, Florida, and Ixtapa/Zihuatanejo, Mexico.
We also further discontinued service to Mexico from several of our non-hub
markets. We also adjusted seasonal service in several markets that we serve.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Throughout our December&nbsp;2007 fiscal quarter
we continued to make several network adjustments to better align to our
strengths.&#160; We implemented more
constrained day of week capacity deployment and reduced capacity or eliminated
service in several non-Denver domestic markets, non-Denver point-to-point flying
to Mexico, and red-eye flying. These changes resulted in a more modest
year-over year mainline growth rate of five to six percent for our fiscal
fourth quarter versus the originally scheduled 15 percent growth.&#160; System-wide capacity growth for our fiscal
fourth quarter was a 13 percent increase, as compared to a planned 21 percent
increase.&#160; The termination of the
agreement with Republic Airlines for regional jet service in April&nbsp;2008
resulted in us reducing our capacity in our fiscal first quarter 2009.&#160; We are finalizing more adjustments that will
further rationalize our network and leverage our position in Colorado and the
Western marketplace.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In May&nbsp;2008, we closed on the sale of two
Airbus A319 aircraft, finalized documentation to sell an additional two A318
aircraft in August&nbsp;2008 and in September&nbsp;2008 we are further reducing
our capacity with route adjustments and the sale of aircraft.&#160; We are currently negotiating agreements to
sell an additional seven Airbus A319 aircraft for a total of 11 aircraft.&#160; With these reductions in our fleet, in September&nbsp;2008
we will implement reductions in our personnel and operations to achieve the
cost savings associated with this reduction in our fleet and routes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June&nbsp;2008, United Airlines, our primary
competitor in the Denver marketplace, announced (i)&nbsp;further cuts that will
result in the retirement of 100 mainline jets and a one-time reduction of
domestic capacity by up to 18% and (ii)&nbsp;discontinuation of their discount
carrier, TED.&#160; Many other airlines have announced
similar reductions in fleet and capacity.&#160;
We will continue to monitor how this impacts our position in the market
place.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">With the route adjustments, termination of the
Republic contract and the planned sale of a total of 11 aircraft, we anticipate
system-wide capacity to decline by approximately 8% in our fiscal quarter
ending September</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">32</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='32',FILE='C:\JMS\ssenthi\08-16762-3\task3012854\16762-3-ba-07.htm',USER='105271',CD='Jul  1 01:02 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">30,
2008 over the same period last year and system-wide capacity to decline by 20%
in the fiscal quarter ending December&nbsp;31, 2008 as compared to the same
period last year.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Cost Structure</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2007,
we announced that we were reducing our indirect labor work force by 10%. The
jobs eliminated were corporate jobs not directly related to flight operations
and resulted in a severance accrual of $442,000 with annual savings of
$2,900,000.&#160; The sale of the additional
aircraft in September&nbsp;and October, if completed, this will force us to
reevaluate our exiting workforce and adjust accordingly.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In May&nbsp;2008,
the Company reached agreements with the pilot and dispatchers unions on
temporary wage and benefit concessions.&#160;
In June&nbsp;2008, the Teamsters Union, which represents approximately
450 mechanics, tool room employees and others, also agreed to temporary wage
and benefit concessions.&#160; All other
employees were given wage reductions effective June&nbsp;1, 2008.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">One of the key elements to keeping our mainline costs low is
maintaining the same family of Airbus aircraft.&nbsp; This strategy produces
cost savings because crew training is standardized for aircraft of a common
type, maintenance issues are simplified, spare parts inventory is reduced, and
scheduling is more efficient.&#160; The
addition of the Bombardier Q400 turboprop aircraft operated through our Lynx
Aviation subsidiary will allow us to add routes to under-served markets in
Colorado and elsewhere in the Rocky Mountain region using the economically
correct gauge of equipment and operating performance.&nbsp;&#160; We also keep our operating costs low by
operating a single class of service, which simplifies our operations, enhances
productivity, increases our capacity and offers an operating cost advantage.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Managing Our Capacity</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For fiscal 2009, we expect to
reduce mainline capacity by approximately 10% versus fiscal 2008.&#160; After a thorough fleet analysis and taking
account of the dramatic increases in the price of fuel and the potential
impacts of a slowing economy, we have elected to sell an additional seven of
our 22 owned Airbus aircraft, in addition to the four aircraft being sold to
VTB Leasing for a total of 11.&#160; The
additional sale of these aircraft allows us to slow our capacity growth and
improve our cash position. The first two Airbus 319 aircraft were sold to VTB
Leasing in May&nbsp;2008.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April&nbsp;23, 2008, we announced that we reached a
mutual agreement with Republic Airways on the terms under which Frontier would
reject the capacity purchase agreement.&#160;
There was a structured reduction and gradual phase-out of Republic&#146;s 12
aircraft from our daily operation which was completed in mid-June&nbsp;2008.&#160; In conjunction with the termination of
service by Republic, we stopped service to six markets.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The airline industry continues to operate in an
intensely competitive environment.&#160; We
expect competition will remain intense, as over-capacity in the industry
continues to exist.&#160; Business and leisure
travelers continue to reevaluate their travel budgets and remain highly price
sensitive.&#160; Increased competition has prompted
aggressive strategies from competitors through discounted fares and sales
promotions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Results of Operations &#150; Year Ended March&nbsp;31,
2008 Compared to Year Ended March&nbsp;31, 2007</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We had a consolidated net loss of $60,253,000 or $1.64 per diluted
share for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, as compared to a consolidated net
loss of $20,370,000 or 56&#162; per diluted share for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Mainline Revenue</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Industry fare pricing
behavior has a significant impact on our revenue.&#160; Because of the elasticity of passenger
demand, we believe that increases in fares may at certain levels result in a
decrease in passenger demand in many markets.&#160;
We cannot predict future fare levels, which depend to a substantial
degree on actions of competitors and the economy.&#160; When sale prices or other price changes are
initiated by competitors in our markets, we believe that we must, in most
cases, match those competitive fares in order to maintain our market
share.&#160; In addition, certain markets we
serve are destinations that cater to vacation or leisure travelers, resulting
in seasonal fluctuations in passenger demand and revenue in these markets.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">33</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='33',FILE='C:\JMS\ssenthi\08-16762-3\task3012854\16762-3-ba-07.htm',USER='105271',CD='Jul  1 01:02 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Passenger Revenue - Mainline</font></i>.</b>&#160; Mainline passenger revenue totaled
$1,218,242,000 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 compared to
$1,037,302,000 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007, an increase of
17.4%.&#160; Mainline passenger revenue
includes revenue for reduced rate stand-by passengers, charter revenue,
administrative fees, revenue recognized for tickets that are not used within
one year from their issue dates and revenue recognized from our co-branded
credit card agreement.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revenue from
passenger tickets flown generated 90.4% of our mainline passenger revenue and
increased $163,894,000 or 17.5% over the prior year.&#160; The increase in flown ticket sales resulted
from a 12.0% increase in ASMs, or $112,446,000, an increase of 4.9 points in
load factor, or $68,078,000, offset by a decrease of 1.5% in our yields from
ticket sales, or $16,630,000.&#160;&#160; The
percentage of revenue generated from other sources compared to total mainline
passenger revenue is as follows: Administrative fees were 2.8%, revenue
recognized for tickets that were not used within one year from issuance were
3.1%, charter revenues were 1.2% and revenue from the travel component of our
co-branded credit card were 2.0%.&#160; These
sources of revenue increased total mainline passenger revenue by $23,461,000 as
compared to the prior year, an increase of 26.6%. This increase is primarily
due to our 16.2% increase in passengers and the increased usage of our
co-branded credit card.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Other Revenue</font></i></b>.&#160; Other revenue, comprised principally of the
revenue from the marketing component of our co-branded credit card, interline
and ground handling fees, liquor sales, LiveTV sales, pay-per-view movies and
excess baggage fees totaled $42,463,000 and $32,603,000 for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2008 and March&nbsp;31, 2007, respectively, an increase of 30.2% and were 3.3%
and 3.0% of total mainline operating revenue for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2008 and 2007, respectively.&#160; The
increase in other revenue was primarily due to the increase in the revenue
earned from carrying excess baggage, ground handling services provided to other
carriers, and the marketing component of our co-branded credit card agreement
and other partnership agreements.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Mainline Operating Expenses</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total mainline
operating expenses were $1,253,904,000 and $1,070,157,000 for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2008 and 2007, respectively, an increase of 17.2%, and represented 99.0% and
99.4% of total mainline revenue, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;text-indent:37.4pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;"> </font><b>Salaries, Wages and Benefits</b>.</font></i>&#160; We record salaries, wages and benefits within
the specific expense category identified in our statements of operations to
which they pertain.&#160; Salaries, wages and
benefits increased 13.5% to $278,955,000 compared to $245,750,000, and were
22.0% and 22.8% of total mainline revenue for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2008 and 2007, respectively.&#160; Salaries,
wages and benefits increased over the prior comparable period largely as a
result of an increase in the number of full-time equivalent employees to
support our continued capacity growth. Our full-time equivalent employee count
increased 8.3% from approximately 4,800 at March&nbsp;31, 2007 to 5,200 at March&nbsp;31,
2008. The increase in employees and related salaries, wages and benefits
supported the 12.0% increase in mainline capacity.</p>

<p style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Flight Operations.</font></i></b>&#160; Flight operations expenses increased 11.3% to
$179,304,000 as compared to $161,144,000, and were 14.2% and 15.0% of total
mainline revenue, for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007,
respectively.&#160; Flight operations expenses
increased due to an increase in mainline block hours from 234,965 for the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 to 264,468 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, an
increase of 12.6%.&#160; Flight operations
expenses include all expenses related directly to the operation of the aircraft
excluding depreciation of owned aircraft and aircraft lease expenses and
including insurance expenses, pilot and flight attendant compensation,
in-flight catering, crew overnight expenses, flight dispatch and flight
operations administrative expenses.</p>

<p style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pilot and
flight attendant salaries before payroll taxes and benefits increased 10.1% to
$104,543,000 compared to $94,953,000, and were 8.3% and 8.8% of total mainline
revenue for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007, respectively.&#160; We employed approximately 1,707 active
mainline pilots and flight attendants at March&nbsp;31, 2008 as compared to
1,586 at March&nbsp;31, 2007, an increase of 7.6%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft insurance expenses totaled $8,118,000 (0.7%
of total mainline revenue) and $9,819,000 (0.9% of total mainline revenue) for
the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007, respectively.&#160; Aircraft insurance expenses were 76&#162; and
$1.07 per passenger for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007,
respectively.&#160; Our aircraft hull and
liability coverage renewed on January&nbsp;1, 2006 to December&nbsp;31, 2006 at
rates that were reduced by 9.9%.&#160; Our
rates were further reduced by 33.4% for the policy that covered January&nbsp;1,
2007 to December&nbsp;31, 2007.&#160; Our
rates were further reduced by almost 18% for the policy that covered January&nbsp;1,
2008 to December&nbsp;31, 2008. In December</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">34</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='34',FILE='C:\JMS\ssenthi\08-16762-3\task3012854\16762-3-ba-07.htm',USER='105271',CD='Jul  1 01:02 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2002, through authority granted under the Homeland
Security Act of 2002, the U.S. government expanded its insurance program to
enable airlines to elect either the government&#146;s excess third-party war risk
coverage or for the government to become the primary insurer for all war risks
coverage.&#160; We elected to take primary
government coverage in February&nbsp;2003 and dropped the commercially
available war risk coverage.&#160; We expect
that if the government stops providing excess war risk coverage to the airline
industry, the premiums charged by aviation insurers for this coverage will be
substantially higher than the premiums currently charged by the government or
the coverage will not be available from reputable underwriters.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Aircraft Fuel.</font></i></b><i>&#160; </i>Aircraft fuel expenses include both the
direct cost of fuel including taxes as well as the cost of delivering fuel into
the aircraft.&#160; Aircraft fuel expenses
also include cash settlements and non-cash mark to market hedge adjustments
related to our fuel hedging activities.&#160; Aircraft
fuel expense of $446,791,000 for 182,793,000 gallons used and $343,082,000 for
161,616,000 gallons used, resulted in an average fuel expense of $2.45 and
$2.12 per gallon for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007,
respectively, an increase of 15.6% per gallon.&#160;
Aircraft fuel expense, excluding hedging losses and gains, were $2.62
and $2.18 per gallon for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007,
respectively, an increase of 20.2%.&#160;
Aircraft fuel expenses represented 35.3% and 31.9% of total mainline
revenue for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007, respectively.&#160; Fuel prices are subject to change weekly as
we purchase a very small portion in advance for inventory. Fuel consumption for
the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007 averaged 691 and 688 gallons per
block hour, respectively, an increase of 0.4%.&#160;
The fuel burn increased largely as a result of the 4.9 point increase in
our load factor during the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 which was partially
offset by the delivery of four more fuel efficient A318 aircraft as compared to
the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our aircraft fuel
expenses for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 was reduced by non-cash mark to
market derivative gains of $1,847,000 and cash settlements of $30,740,000
received from a counter-party.&#160; Our
aircraft fuel expenses for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 include a
non-cash mark to market derivative gain of $12,753,000 recorded as a decrease
to fuel expense offset by cash settlements of $3,925,000 paid to a
counter-party recorded as an increase in fuel expense.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft and Engine Lease.</font></i></b>
<font style="font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">Aircraft lease expenses
totaled $112,856,000 (8.9% of total mainline revenue) and $108,623,000 (10.1%
of total mainline revenue) for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007,
respectively, an increase of 3.9%.&#160; The
increase in lease expense is due to an increase in the average number of leased
aircraft from 36.7 to 38.0, or 3.5%.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:37.4pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Aircraft and Traffic Servicing.</font></i></b>&#160; Aircraft and traffic servicing expenses were
$183,239,000 and $166,409,000, for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and
2007, respectively, an increase of 10.1%, and represented 14.5% and 15.5% of
total mainline revenue. &#160;Aircraft and
traffic servicing expenses include all expenses incurred at airports including
landing fees, facilities rental, station labor, ground handling expenses,
glycol de-icing expense, and interrupted trip expenses associated with delayed
or cancelled flights.&#160; Interrupted trip
expenses are amounts paid to other airlines to protect passengers on cancelled
flights as well as hotel, meal and other incidental expenses.&#160;&#160; Aircraft and traffic servicing expenses will
increase with the addition of new cities to our route system or as rates and
charges at airports where we operate are increased.&#160; During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008,
our departures increased to 104,548 from 97,554, an increase of 7.2%.&#160; Aircraft and traffic servicing expenses were
$1,753 per departure for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 as compared to
$1,706 per departure for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007, an increase of $47
per departure or 2.8%.&#160;&#160; This increase
was primarily due to rent increases for the additional six gates at DIA and
$2,668,000 of additional glycol expenses incurred during the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2008.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Maintenance.</font></i></b>&#160; Maintenance expenses of $102,384,000 and
$87,733,000 were 8.1% of total mainline revenue for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2008 and 2007, and increased by 16.7%.&#160; &#160;Maintenance expenses include the costs of all
labor, parts and supplies related to the maintenance of the aircraft.&#160; Maintenance cost per block hour was $387 and
$373 for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007, respectively, an
increase of 3.8%.&#160; During the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2008, our engine maintenance reserve payments increased by $4,400,000 due to an
increase in our rates under the applicable lease and also due to two major
unscheduled maintenance events that were not covered by maintenance agreements
which increased maintenance expenses by $1,315,000.&#160; Maintenance expenses will increase as the
average age of our aircraft increases and our aircraft require more scheduled
maintenance events. The average age of our aircraft was 3.9 years as of March&nbsp;31,
2008 as compared to 3.2 as of March&nbsp;31, 2007.</p>

<p style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Promotion and Sales</font></i></b><i>.&#160; </i>Promotion and sales
expenses totaled $129,625,000 and $115,516,000, an increase of 12.2%, and were
10.2% and 10.7% of total mainline revenue for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2008 and 2007,</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">35</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">respectively.&#160;
These expenses include advertising expenses, telecommunications
expenses, wages and benefits for reservation agents and related supervision as
well as marketing management and sales personnel, credit card fees, travel
agency commissions and computer reservations costs.&#160; During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008,
promotion and sales expenses per mainline passenger decreased to $12.20 from
$12.64 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007.&#160;
Promotion and sales expenses decreased per passenger primarily due to a
reduction in spending on promotions and advertising.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">General and Administrative.</font></i></b>&#160; General
and administrative expenses for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007
totaled $60,713,000 and $53,674,000, respectively, an increase of 13.1%, and
were 4.8% and 5.0% of total mainline revenue, respectively. General and
administrative expenses include the wages and benefits for our executive
officers and various other administrative personnel including legal, accounting,
information technology, corporate communications, training and human resources
and other expenses associated with these departments.&#160; General and administrative expenses also
include employee health benefits, accrued vacation, and general insurance
expenses including worker&#146;s compensation for all of our employees. General and
administrative expenses increased primarily due to general wage rate increases,
expenses due to changes in management, an increase in our vacation liability,
offset by a decrease in our workers compensation expense as compared to the
same period last year.</p>

<p style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Depreciation.</font></i></b>&#160; Depreciation expenses were $43,120,000 and
$34,689,000, an increase of 24.3%, and were approximately 3.4% and 3.2% of
total mainline revenue for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007,
respectively.&#160; These expenses include
depreciation of aircraft and aircraft components, office equipment, ground
station equipment, and other fixed assets.&#160;
The increase in depreciation is primarily due to an increase in the average
number of purchased aircraft in service to 21.6 during the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2008 as compared to 17.7 purchased aircraft in service for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2007, an increase of 22.0%.&#160; The increase
in depreciation expense is also due to a project to replace our Airbus seats
with new lighter weight leather seats, which resulted in accelerated
depreciation of $3,339,000 on the replaced Airbus aircraft seats. This project
was completed in May&nbsp;2008. The increase is also due to investments in rotable
aircraft components, aircraft improvements and ground equipment to support the
12.0% increase in our capacity during the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008.</p>

<p style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Post-Retirement Liability Curtailment
Gain.&#160; </font></i></b>In December&nbsp;2007,
the <i>Fair Treatment for Experienced Pilots</i>
Act (the &#147;Pilots Act&#148;), was enacted.&#160;
This act increased the retirement age for commercial pilots to 65 from
60.&#160; Pilots that have not reached age 60
will now be allowed to work for five more years, provided they pass regular
medical and piloting exams. <b><i style="font-weight:bold;">&#160;</i></b>Pursuant to our collective
bargaining agreement with our pilots, if pilots are forced to retire due to FAA
requirements, the retired pilots and their dependents could retain medical
benefits under the terms and conditions of the Health and Welfare Plan for
Employees of Frontier Airlines,&nbsp;Inc. until age 65.&#160; However, as a result of the Pilots Act, this
retirement health benefit is no longer required.&#160; It is only required for pilots who reached
mandatory retirement age prior to the effective date of the Pilots Act.<b><i style="font-weight:bold;">&#160; </i></b>As
such, we recorded a one-time post-retirement liability curtailment gain of
$6,361,000 to reflect the impact of the Pilots Act, which was the reduction in
post-retirement liability for pilots who had not yet attained the age of 60.</p>

<p style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Business Interruption
Insurance Proceeds.</font></i></b>&#160; During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, we
recorded insurance proceeds of $300,000 as a result of final settlements of
business interruption claims. During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 we recorded insurance proceeds of $868,000 as a
result of final settlements of business interruption claims that covered lost
profits when our service to Cancun, Mexico and New Orleans, Louisiana was
disrupted by hurricanes during the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2006.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Consolidated Nonoperating Expenses</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Nonoperating Expense.&#160; </font></i></b>Net nonoperating
expense totaled $25,324,000 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 as compared
to net nonoperating expense of $15,162,000 for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2007, an increase of 67.0%.</p>

<p style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;text-indent:37.4pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;"> </font></i><b><i style="font-weight:bold;">Interest
Income. </i></b><i>&#160;</i>Interest income decreased to
$12,048,000 from $14,982,000 during the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 from the
year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007, a decrease of 19.6%, as a result of a decrease
in our average cash position as compared to the prior year.</p>

<p style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;text-indent:37.4pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Interest Expense.&#160; </font></i></b>Interest expense
increased to $36,444,000 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 from
$29,899,000 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007, an increase of 26.1%. Debt
related to aircraft increased from $386,755,000 as of March&nbsp;31, 2007 to
$567,318,000 as of March&nbsp;31, 2008 with a decrease in the average weighted
interest rate from 7.15% to 5.50% as of March&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2008,
respectively.&#160; The increase in interest
expense</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">36</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">was due to additional debt for the increase
in the average number of owned aircraft during the year from 17.7 to 21.6,
offset by a 23.1% decrease in the weighted average borrowing rate.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Income Tax Benefit.</font></i></b><i>&#160; </i>We recorded an
income tax benefit of $101,000 during the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008,
comprised of current state refunds.&#160; We
have a valuation allowance for all deferred tax assets that are not realizable
through the reversal of existing taxable temporary differences as of March&nbsp;31,
2008 and 2007, accordingly, deferred tax expense is zero during the fiscal year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2008.&#160; We recorded
an income tax benefit of $4,626,000 during the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007,
which includes a valuation allowance of $3,980,000 which resulted in an
effective tax rate of 18.5%.&#160; During the
year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 we increased our valuation allowance by
$21,418,000 against deferred tax assets since it was more likely than not that
these tax benefits were not going to be realized due to lack of taxable income
in these jurisdictions before those net operating loss carryforwards expire and
concerns about our ability to continue as a going concern.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Loss on Early Extinguishment of Debt.&#160; </font></i></b>Prior to the
closing of the five sale-leaseback transactions for Bombardier Q400 aircraft
during the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, we had temporary financing for the
aircraft which we repaid and wrote off $283,000 of debt issuance fees.</p>

<p style="margin:0in .5pt .0001pt 0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Regional Partners</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">Regional Partner revenue were
derived from flights operated by Republic, Horizon and ExpressJet.&#160; Our mainline passenger revenue increased as a
result of incremental revenue from passengers connecting to/from regional
flights.&#160; Regional Partner operating
expense include all direct costs associated with Regional Partners flights plus
a margin and payments of performance bonuses if earned under the contract.&#160; Certain expenses such as aircraft lease,
maintenance and crew costs are included in the operating agreements with our
Regional Partners, and we reimbursed these expenses plus a margin.&#160; Regional Partner operating expenses also
include other direct costs incurred for which we do not pay a margin.&#160; These expenses are primarily composed of
fuel, airport facility expenses and passenger related expenses.</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Passenger Revenue &#150; Regional Partner.</font></i></b>&#160; <font style="font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">Regional Partner revenue totaled $113,196,000 for the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and $94,164,000 for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2007, a 20.2% increase.&#160; The increase in
revenue is due to a 26.3% increase in passengers offset by a decrease in the
average fare to $99.74 from $ 104.72, a decrease of 4.8%.&#160; The decrease in average fare is largely due
to the increase in connecting traffic over the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007,
which results in a lower fare than local traffic.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating Expenses &#150; Regional Partner.</font></i></b>&#160; <font style="font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">Regional
partner expense for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007 totaled
$146,211,000 and $108,355,000, respectively, a 34.9% increase, and were 129.2%
and&#160; 115.1% of total regional partner
revenue, respectively.&#160; The increase in
Regional Partner expenses as compared to revenue was primarily related to the
transition of our regional jet service from Horizon to Republic, which caused
both airlines to operate with a sub-optimal number of aircraft during the year
and an increase in fuel costs to $51,817,000 for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2008 as compared to $33,163,000 during the same period in the prior year.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Lynx
Aviation</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Passenger Revenue &#150; Lynx Aviation</font></i>.</b>&#160; Passenger revenue from flights operated by
Lynx Aviation after obtaining its operating certificate on December&nbsp;6,
2007 totaled $18,989,000 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Lynx Aviation Expenses</font></i></b><b><i style="font-weight:bold;">.</i></b> Lynx Aviation was in the start-up
phase of operations until December&nbsp;7, 2007 when it began revenue
service.&#160; For the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2008, operating expenses were $34,196,000.&#160;
We do not believe that the results of Lynx Aviation during the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 are indicative of future results because the fleet
was flown in sub-optimal routes, additional crew were required for training and
Lynx Aviation had low completion factors.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">During the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, Lynx Aviation incurred $8,454,000 of start-up
expense related to flight operation expenses primarily related to pilot
salaries and training, maintenance expenses related to salaries and wages for
material specialists personnel, line maintenance performed on aircraft and
training for our Lynx Aviation mechanics and general and administrative costs
primarily related to costs of constructing our internal manual and procedures
to FAA standards and the FAA certification process.&#160; After obtaining an operating certificate in December&nbsp;2007,
additional direct and allocated costs of $25,742,000 were incurred related to
5,228 departures.</font></i></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">37</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">During the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2007, Lynx Aviation incurred $3,139,000 of start-up costs
primarily related to consulting and legal expenses incurred in conjunction with
signing the purchase agreement with Bombardier,&nbsp;Inc. for Q400 aircraft and
the formation of the subsidiary.</font></i></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">38</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='38',FILE='C:\JMS\ssenthi\08-16762-3\task3012854\16762-3-ba-07.htm',USER='105271',CD='Jul  1 01:02 2008' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Results
of Operations &#150; Year Ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 Compared to Year Ended March&nbsp;31,
2006</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We had a consolidated net
loss of $20,370,000 or 56&#162; per diluted share for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2007, as compared to a consolidated net loss of $13,971,000 or 39&#162; per diluted
share for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2006.&#160;
Included in our net loss for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 were the
following items: (i)&nbsp;a decrease in fuel expense for non-cash mark to
market derivative gains of $12,753,000 and an increase in fuel expense of
$3,925,000 paid to counter-party for fuel hedge settlements; (ii)&nbsp;$656,000
in gains on Boeing parts held for sale (iii)&nbsp;$3,139,000 of start-up costs
for Lynx Aviation; and (iv)&nbsp;a tax valuation allowance of $3,980,000.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Included in our net loss
for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2006 were the following items before the
effect of income taxes: (i)&nbsp; aircraft lease and facility exit charges of
$3,414,000 primarily relating to three leased Boeing 737-300 aircraft that we
ceased using during the first quarter; (ii)&nbsp;gains of $1,144,000 related to
the sale of Boeing parts held for sale and other assets; and (iii)&nbsp;an
increase in fuel expense for non-cash mark to market losses on fuel hedges of
$2,163,000 and a decrease of $5,338,000 for net receipts for fuel hedge
settlements.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Mainline
Revenue</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Passenger Revenue - Mainline</font></i>.</b>&#160; Mainline passenger revenue totaled
$1,037,302,000 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 compared to $878,681,000
for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2006, an increase of 18.1%.&#160; Mainline passenger revenue include revenue
for reduced rate stand-by passengers, charter revenue, administrative fees,
revenue recognized for tickets that are not used within one year from their
issue dates and revenue recognized from our co-branded credit card agreement.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revenue from ticketed
passenger sales generated 90.4% of our mainline passenger revenue and increased
$137,676,000 or 17.2% over the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2006.&#160; The increase in mainline revenue earned from
ticketed passenger sales resulted from a 14.4% increase in ASMs, or
$115,282,000, an increase of 0.2 points in load factor, or $2,596,000, and an
increase in our yields from ticket sales of 2.2% or $19,798,000.&#160;&#160; The percentage of revenue generated from
other sources compared to total mainline passenger revenue are as follows:
Administrative fees were 2.7%; revenue recognized for tickets that were not
used within one year from issuance were 3.0%, charter revenue were 0.9% and
revenue from the travel component of our co-branded credit card were 1.9%.&#160; These sources of revenue increased total
mainline passenger revenue by $20,317,000 as compared to the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2006.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Other Revenue</font></i></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160;
Other revenue, comprised principally of the revenue from the marketing
component of our co-branded credit card, interline and ground handling fees,
liquor sales, LiveTV sales, pay-per-view movies and excess baggage fees totaled
$32,603,000 and $24,338,000 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 and March&nbsp;31,
2006, respectively, an increase of 34.0% and were 3.0% and 2.7% of total mainline
operating revenue for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006.&#160; The increase in other revenue was primarily
due to the increase of $6,646,000 in the revenue earned for the marketing
component of our co-branded credit card agreement and other partnership
agreements.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Mainline
Operating Expenses</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total mainline operating
expenses were $1,070,157,000 and $902,553,000 for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2007 and 2006, respectively, an increase of 18.6%, and represented 99.4% and
99.3% of total mainline revenue, respectively.&#160;
Mainline operating expenses increased slightly as a percentage of
mainline revenue during the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2006 largely a result of
a 6.5% increase in our aircraft fuel cost per gallon for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2006 as compared to the prior comparable period.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><i><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;"> </font></i><b><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Salaries, Wages and Benefits</font></i></b><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Salaries,
wages and benefits increased 12.0% to $245,750,000 compared to $219,380,000,
and were 22.8% and 24.1% of total mainline revenue for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2007 and 2006, respectively.&#160; Salaries,
wages and benefits increased over the prior comparable period largely as a
result of an increase in the number of full-time equivalent employees to
support our continued capacity growth.&#160;
Our full-time equivalent employee count increased from approximately
4,200 at March&nbsp;31, 2006 to 4,800 at March&nbsp;31, 2007, or 14.3%.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Flight
Operations.</font></i></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Flight operations expenses increased 14.0% to
$161,144,000 as compared to $141,316,000, and were 15.0% and 15.5% of total
mainline revenue, for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006, </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">39</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
