<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">respectively.&#160;
Flight operations expenses increased due to an increase in mainline
block hours from 202,300 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2006 to 234,965 for
the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007, an increase of 16.1%.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pilot and flight attendant salaries before payroll
taxes and benefits increased 15.0% to $94,953,000 compared to $82,566,000, and
were 8.8% and 9.1% of total mainline revenue for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2007 and 2006, respectively.&#160; We employed
approximately 1,865 full time equivalent pilots and flight attendants at March&nbsp;31,
2007 as compared to 1,614 at March&nbsp;31, 2006, an increase of 15.6%.&#160; We increased the number of pilots and flight
attendants over the prior year to support the 16.1% increase in block hours and
the 12.2% increase in the average aircraft in service.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft insurance expenses totaled $9,819,000 (0.9%
of total mainline revenue) and $9,896,000 (1.1% of total mainline revenue) for
the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006, respectively.&#160; Aircraft insurance expenses were $1.07 per
passenger and $1.27 per passenger for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 and
2006, respectively, a decrease on a per passenger basis of 15.7%.&#160; Our aircraft hull and liability coverage
renewed on January&nbsp;1,
2006 to December&nbsp;31, 2006 at rates that were reduced by 9.9%. &#160;Our rates were further reduced by 33.4% for
the policy that covers January&nbsp;1, 2007 to December&nbsp;31, 2007.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Aircraft Fuel.</font></i></b><i>&#160; </i>Aircraft
fuel expense of $343,082,000 for 161,616,000 gallons used and $281,906,000 for
141,474,000 gallons used and resulted in an average fuel cost of $2.12 and
$1.99 per gallon for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006, respectively,
an increase of 6.5% per gallon.&#160; Aircraft
fuel expense, excluding hedging losses and gains, were $2.18 and $2.02 per
gallon for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006, respectively, an
increase of 7.9%.&#160; Aircraft fuel expenses
represented 31.9% and 31.0% of total mainline revenue for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2007 and 2006, respectively.&#160; Fuel
consumption for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006 averaged 688 and
699 gallons per block hour, respectively, a decrease of 1.6%.&#160; Fuel consumption per block hour decreased
during the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 from the prior year due to the
implementation of several fuel conservation initiatives.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our aircraft fuel
expenses for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 include a non-cash mark to
market derivative gain of $12,753,000 recorded as a decrease to fuel expense
offset by cash settlements of $3,925,000 paid to a counter-party recorded as an
increase in fuel expense.&#160;&#160; Our aircraft
fuel expenses for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2006 include a non-cash mark to
market derivative loss of $2,163,000 recorded an increase to fuel expense
offset by cash settlements of $5,338,000 received from a counter-party recorded
as a decrease in fuel expense.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft and Engine Lease.</font></i></b>  <font style="font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">Aircraft lease expenses totaled
$108,623,000 (10.1% of total mainline revenue) and $94,229,000 (10.4% of total
mainline revenue) for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006,
respectively, an increase of 15.3%.&#160; The
increase in lease expense is due to an increase in the average number of leased
aircraft from 32.7 to 36.7, or 12.2%, and increases in lease rates for four of
our aircraft that have variable rents based on LIBOR.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Aircraft
and Traffic Servicing.</font></i></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> Aircraft and traffic servicing expenses were
$166,409,000 and $138,492,000, an increase of 20.2%, for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2007 and 2006, respectively, and represented 15.5% and 15.2% of total mainline
revenue.&#160; Aircraft and traffic servicing
expenses will increase with the addition of new cities to our route
system.&#160; During the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2007, our departures increased to 97,554 from 82,878 for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2006, an increase of 17.7%.&#160; Aircraft and
traffic servicing expenses were $1,706 per departure for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2007 as compared to $1,671 per departure for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2006, an increase of 2.1%.&#160; Aircraft and
traffic servicing during the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 included an
increase in glycol expenses of $3,300,000, or 83.6%, over the prior year
primarily related to the significant snow storms in Denver in December&nbsp;2006
and January&nbsp;2007.&#160; In addition, we
had additional operating costs of $5,106,000 during the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2007 as compared to the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2006 primarily related
to our Los Angeles to San Francisco shuttle, which operated five times a day,
and an increase in the rates charged by the Los Angeles airport.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Maintenance.</font></i></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;
Maintenance expenses of $87,733,000 and $77,238,000 were 8.1% and 8.5%
of total revenue for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006,
respectively, an increase of 13.7% as compared to the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2006.&#160; Maintenance cost per block hour
was $373 and $382 for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006,
respectively, a decrease of 2.4%, primarily related to several leased aircraft
in which supplemental rent amounts reached the maximum reserve amount required
during the year and increases in maintenance labor performed in which we
receive reimbursement against these reserves.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">40</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Promotion
and Sales</font></i></b><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Promotion and sales expenses totaled
$115,516,000 and $89,751,000 and were 10.7% and 9.9% of total mainline revenue
for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006, respectively, an increase of
28.7%.&#160; During the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2006, promotion and sales expense was reduced by $4,444,000 due to the
favorable resolution of a sales and use tax credit on the taxation of ticketing
services that related to the period September&nbsp;2001 to March&nbsp;2005.&#160; During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007,
promotion and sales expenses, per mainline passenger increased to $12.64 from
$12.13 (excluding the sales and use tax credit) for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2006.&#160; Promotion and sales expenses per
mainline passenger increased primarily as a result of an increase in the commission rates paid to external travel websites,
an increase in advertising expenses and the inclusion of the favorable tax
ruling in the fiscal year 2006 promotion and sales expense.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">General
and Administrative.</font></i></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; General and administrative expenses for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2007 and 2006 totaled $53,674,000 and $48,979,000, respectively, an increase of
9.6%, and were 5.0% and 5.4% of total mainline revenue, respectively. General
and administrative expenses increased due to increases in our worker&#146;s
compensation expense, consulting and legal expenses (primarily related to the
start-up of Lynx Aviation) offset by a reduction in our health insurance
expense as compared to the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Depreciation.</font></i></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;
Depreciation expenses were $34,689,000 and $28,372,000 and were
approximately 3.2% and 3.1% of total mainline revenue for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2007 and 2006, respectively, an increase of 22.3%.&#160; These expenses include depreciation of
aircraft and aircraft components, office equipment, ground station equipment,
and other fixed assets.&#160; The increase in
depreciation is primarily due to an increase in the average number of purchased
aircraft in service to 17.7 during the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 as
compared to 15.5 purchased aircraft in service for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2006, an increase of 14.2%.&#160; The increase
in depreciation expense is also due to accelerated depreciation on our aircraft
seats which we are replacing over the next two fiscal years and investments in
rotable aircraft components, aircraft improvements and ground equipment to
support the 14.4% increase in our capacity during the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2007.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Business interruption insurance proceeds.</font></i></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; We recorded insurance proceeds of $868,000 for
the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 as a result of final settlements of business
interruption claims that covered lost profits when our service to Cancun,
Mexico and New Orleans, Louisiana were disrupted by hurricanes during the
fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Consolidated Nonoperating
Expenses</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Nonoperating
(Income) Expense.&#160; </font></i></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net nonoperating expense totaled $15,162,000
for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 as compared to net nonoperating expense
of $12,571,000 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2006, an increase of 20.6%.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><i><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;"> </font></i><b><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Interest Income.</font></i></b><b><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#160; </font></i></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest income increased to $14,982,000 from
$9,366,000 during the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 from the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2006 as a result of an increase in short-term interest rates earned on
investments and an increase in our average cash position during the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2007 largely as a result of the net proceeds of $88,759,000 from our
convertible notes offering in December&nbsp;2005.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Interest
Expense.</font></i></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Interest expense, net of capitalized
interest, increased to $29,899,000 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 from
$21,758,000 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2006, an increase of 37.4%.&#160; The increase in interest expense was a result
of additional debt for the acquisition of three additional purchased aircraft,
an increase in the weighted average borrowing rate and additional debt of
$92,000,000 from our convertible notes offering in December&nbsp;2005.&#160; Debt related to aircraft increased from
$335,756,000 as of March&nbsp;31, 2006 to $386,755,000 as of March&nbsp;31,
2007 with an increase in the average weighted interest rate from 6.55% to 7.15%
as of March&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2007, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Income
Tax Benefit.</font></i></b><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We recorded an income tax
benefit</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> of $4,626,000
during the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007, which includes a valuation allowance
of $3,980,000 which resulted in an effective tax rate of 18.5%, compared to an
income tax benefit of $6,497,000 during the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2006 at a
31.7% rate.&#160; During the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2007, our tax benefit was at a federal rate of 35.0% plus the blended state
rate of 2.7% (net of federal benefit) and was decreased by the tax effect of
permanent differences of 3.6%.&#160; During
the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006, we recorded valuation allowances
of $3,980,000 and $273,000 against federal and certain state net operating loss
carryforwards because it was more likely than not that these tax benefits </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">41</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='41',FILE='C:\JMS\pmurali\08-16762-3\task3013036\16762-3-ba-09.htm',USER='105425',CD='Jul  1 01:50 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">were not going to be
realized due to lack of taxable income in these jurisdictions before those net
operating loss carryforwards expire.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Regional Partner</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Passenger Revenue &#150; Regional Partner.</font></i></b>&#160; <font style="font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">Regional partner revenue totaled $94,164,000 for the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 and $92,826,000 for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2006, a 1.4% increase.&#160; The increase in
revenue is due to an increase in the average fare to $104.72 during the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 from $101.78 during the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2006, an increase of 2.9%.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating Expenses &#150; Regional Partner.</font></i></b>&#160; <font style="font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">Regional
partner expense for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006 totaled
$108,355,000 and $106,866,000, respectively, a 1.4% increase, and was 115.1% of
total regional partner revenue for each of the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2007
and 2006. The increase in expenses is primarily due to a $1,450,000 increase in
fuel expense for the regional partner operations as compared to the prior year.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="center" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">42</font></i></b></p>

<div align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left">

</font></i></b></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='42',FILE='C:\JMS\pmurali\08-16762-3\task3013036\16762-3-ba-09.htm',USER='105425',CD='Jul  1 01:50 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Liquidity
and Capital Resources</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The matters described herein, to the extent that they relate to future
events or expectations, may be significantly affected by our Chapter&nbsp;11
proceedings. Those proceedings will involve, or may result in, various
restrictions on our activities, limitations on financing, the need to obtain
Bankruptcy Court approval for various matters and uncertainty as to
relationships with vendors, suppliers, customers and others whom we may conduct
or seek to conduct business.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our liquidity depends to a large extent on the number of passengers who
fly with us, the fares they pay, our operating and capital expenditures, our
financing activities, the amount of cash holdbacks imposed by our credit card
processors, and the cost of fuel.&#160; Our
liquidity will be negatively impacted by the record high price of fuel which as
of June&nbsp;23, 2008 was $4.22 per gallon, and an increase in the cash
holdbacks by our credit card processors.&#160;
On May&nbsp;16, 2008, we closed on the sale of two Airbus 319 aircraft
to VTB Leasing, for proceeds of $59,000,000. This resulted in retirement of
debt of $33,754,000 related to the mortgage on the sold aircraft and a book
gain of $9,200,000 on the transactions</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> We are currently pursuing a number of liquidity
improvement alternatives, including debtor in possession financing, additional
sales or sale-leasebacks of aircraft and other assets, and negotiation of the
cash holdbacks or letters of credit associated with our Visa/MasterCard credit
card processing agreement.&#160; While we are
negotiating many of these alternatives, the ultimate outcome of these
negotiations and our resulting liquidity improvement cannot be predicted with
certainty.&#160; If these efforts to raise
cash and improve liquidity are not successful, we could be forced to
discontinue our operations.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We had cash and
cash equivalents of $120,837,000 and $202,981,000 at March&nbsp;31, 2008 and March&nbsp;31,
2007, respectively.&#160; At March&nbsp;31,
2008, total current assets were $306,286,000 as compared to $449,367,000 of
total current liabilities, resulting in a working capital deficit of
$143,081,000.&#160; At March&nbsp;31, 2007,
total current assets were $340,405,000 as compared to $359,326,000 of total
current liabilities, resulting in a working capital deficit of
$18,921,000.&#160; The decrease in working
capital is primarily due to additional pre-delivery payments made of $28,332,000
future aircraft deliveries, an increase in the current portion of long-term
debt of $11,385,000 as a result of additional debt for aircraft purchases,
capital expenditures for aircraft and other assets in excess of financings and
payments on long-term debt of $113,961,000 offset by cash provided by operating
activities of $30,673,000.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;"> </font><b><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Operating Activitie</font></i></b><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">s.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;
Cash provided by operating activities for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2008 was $30,673,000 as compared to cash provided by operating activities of
$23,227,000 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007, an increase of $7,446,000.
The increase in operating cash flows was primarily due to an increase in our
air traffic liability and an increase in our accounts payable balance, offset
by the use of cash for our restricted investments.&#160;&#160; During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, a
$42,263,000 increase in our air traffic liability was due to a 25% increase in
our number of segments booked as compared to March&nbsp;31, 2007.&#160; Accounts payable increased due to slower
payments to our vendors.&#160; These were
offset by a $22,114,000 increase in restricted investments to $31,275,000 as
compared to an increase of $9,161,000 during the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2007, primarily due to increased hold-back provisions from our credit card
processors and an increase in our air traffic liability over prior year.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Investing Activities</font></i></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; Cash used in
investing activities for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 was
$294,534,000.&#160; Capital expenditures were
$350,844,000 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, which included the
purchase of three Airbus A318 aircraft, two Airbus A320 aircraft and ten
Bombardier Q400 aircraft, new leather seat sets for 53 aircraft, the purchase
of LiveTV equipment, rotable aircraft components, aircraft improvements,
information technology enhancements, and ground equipment.&#160; Aircraft lease and purchase deposits made for
aircraft deliveries during the period were $28,332,000.&#160; We also received $92,525,000 primarily from
the sale of five of the 10 newly acquired Bombardier Q400 aircraft in
sale-leaseback transactions.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">Cash used in
investing activities for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 was
$141,310,000.&#160; Capital expenditures were
$137,324,000 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007, which included the
purchase of three Airbus A319 aircraft, one Airbus A318 aircraft and one spare
engine, the purchase of LiveTV equipment, rotable aircraft components, aircraft
improvements, information technology enhancements, and ground equipment.&#160; Aircraft lease and purchase deposits made
during the period were $47,933,000, including $15,276,000 for pre-delivery
payments on Bombardier Q400 aircraft.&#160; We
also received $41,933,000 primarily from the sale of one of three newly
acquired Airbus A319 aircraft and a spare engine in two sale-leaseback
transactions.</font></i></b></p>

<p align="center" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="center" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">43</font></i></b></p>

<div align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left">

</font></i></b></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='43',FILE='C:\JMS\pmurali\08-16762-3\task3013036\16762-3-ba-09.htm',USER='105425',CD='Jul  1 01:50 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Financing Activities</font></i></b><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Cash received
from financing activities for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 was $181,717,000.&#160; During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, we
borrowed $297,525,000 for the purchase of three Airbus A318, two Airbus A320
and 10 Bombardier Q400 aircraft.&#160; These
were offset by debt principal payments of $113,961,000 on 29 of our owned
Airbus and Bombardier aircraft and $2,603,000 in financing fees.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cash provided by financing activities for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2007 was $48,224,000.&#160; During the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2007, we paid $23,439,000 of debt principal payments on 19
owned aircraft and we borrowed $74,438,000 for two additional Airbus A319
aircraft and one Airbus A318 aircraft. We also were required to increase our
compensating balance at a bank by $750,000 to secure letters of credit.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Other Items That Impact Our Liquidity</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We continue to assess our liquidity position in light
of record high fuel prices, significant legal and professional fees associated
with our Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceeding, our aircraft purchase commitments
and other capital requirements, the economy, our competition, and other
uncertainties surrounding the airline industry.&#160;&#160;&#160; For further information on our financing
plans, activities and commitments, see &#147;Contractual Obligations&#148; and &#147;Commercial
Commitments and Off Balance Sheet Arrangements&#148; below.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our
purchase rights for 17 Airbus aircraft expired on July&nbsp;1, 2007.&#160; We have options to purchase 10 Bombardier
aircraft, the last of which expires in July&nbsp;2010, subject to additional
extension rights.&#160; If we are unable to
secure all the necessary financing it could result in the loss of pre-delivery
payments and deposits (see discussion in the Contractual Obligations section
below).</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Contractual
Obligations</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table summarizes our contractual
obligations as of March&nbsp;31, 2008, for debt; operating leases; aircraft
order commitments; capital leases; interest and related payments; other
material, noncancelable purchase obligations; other liabilities.&#160; We are in the process of evaluating our
executory contracts in order to determine which contracts will be assumed in
our Chapter&nbsp;11 proceedings.&#160;
Therefore, obligations as currently quantified in the table below and in
the text immediately following the footnotes to the table will continue to
change:</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Less&nbsp;than</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.7%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2-3</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.7%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.7%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">After</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 18.7pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-18.7pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At
March&nbsp;31, 2008, we had loans covering 13 Airbus A319 aircraft, nine Airbus
A318 aircraft, five Bombardier Q400 aircraft and two Airbus A320 aircraft.&#160; Two of the loans have a term of ten years and
are payable in equal monthly installments, including interest, payable in
arrears.&#160; These loans require monthly
principal and interest payments of $218,000 and $215,000, bear interest at
6.71% and 6.54%, and mature in May&nbsp;and August&nbsp;2011, at which time a
balloon payment totaling $10,200,000 is due with respect to each loan.&#160; The remaining 22 loans have interest rates
based on LIBOR plus margins that adjust quarterly or semi-annually.&#160; At March&nbsp;31, 2008, interest rates for
these loans ranged from 3.88% to 6.79%.&#160; Each
of these loans has a term of 12 years, and each loan has balloon payments
ranging from $2,640,000 to $9,312,000 at the end of the term.&#160; All of the loans are secured by the aircraft.&#160; Actual interest payments will change based on
changes in LIBOR.&#160; In July&nbsp;2005, we </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">44</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='44',FILE='C:\JMS\pmurali\08-16762-3\task3013036\16762-3-ba-09.htm',USER='105425',CD='Jul  1 01:50 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 18.7pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">also
entered into a junior loan in the amount of $4,900,000 on an Airbus A319
aircraft.&#160; This loan has a seven-year
term with quarterly installments of approximately $250,000.&#160; The loan bears interest at a floating rate
adjusted quarterly based on LIBOR, which was 8.06% at March&nbsp;31, 2008.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 18.7pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-18.7pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 18.7pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
December&nbsp;2005, we issued $92,000,000 of 5% convertible notes due
2025.&#160; At any time on or after December&nbsp;20,
2010, we may redeem any of the convertible notes for the principal amount plus
accrued interest.&#160; Note holders may
require us to repurchase the notes for cash for the principal amount plus
accrued interest only on December&nbsp;15, 2010, 2015 and 2020 or at any time
prior to their maturity following a designated event as defined in the
indenture for the convertible notes.&#160;
Holders may convert the notes into shares of our common stock at a
conversion rate of 96.7352 shares per $1,000 principal amount (representing a
conversion price of approximately $10.34 per share).&#160; In the contractual obligations table above,
the convertible notes are reflected based on their stated maturity of December&nbsp;2025
with the corresponding interest payments.&#160;
However, these notes may be called at the earlier times discussed above,
which would impact the timing of the principal payments.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 18.7pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 18.7pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-18.7pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In November&nbsp;2007, we entered into a
pre-delivery deposit facility (&#147;PDP Facility&#148;) for the purpose of financing
obligations to make pre-delivery payments on eight A320 aircraft.&#160; The PDP Facility allows us to draw amounts up
to $22,200,000 for aircraft deliveries through August&nbsp;2010.&#160; As of March&nbsp;31, 2008, we had $3,139,000
outstanding under the PDP Facility for A320 aircraft deliveries scheduled for February&nbsp;2009.&#160; As such, the amount outstanding is classified
as short-term borrowings on the consolidated balance sheet.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 18.7pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-18.7pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>As
of March&nbsp;31, 2008, we leased 36 Airbus A319 type aircraft, two Airbus A318
aircraft, and five Bombardier Q400 aircraft under operating leases with
expiration dates ranging from 2013 to 2022.&#160;
Under all of our leases, we have made cash security deposits, which
totaled $23,090,000 at March&nbsp;31, 2008.&#160;
Additionally, we are required to make additional rent payments to cover
the cost of major scheduled maintenance overhauls of these aircraft. These
additional rent payments are based on the number of flight hours flown and/or
flight departures and are not included as an obligation in the table above.
During the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, 2007 and 2006, additional rent
expense to cover the cost of major scheduled maintenance overhauls of these
aircraft totaled $27,583,000, $26,187,000 and $24,933,000, respectively, and
are included in maintenance expense in the statements of operations.&#160; On January&nbsp;11, 2007, we signed an agreement
with Republic, under which Republic would operate up to 17 Embraer 170 aircraft
each with capacity of up to 76 seats.&#160;
The contract period was for an 11-year period starting on the date the
last aircraft is placed in service, which was scheduled for December&nbsp;2008.&#160; The service began on March&nbsp;4, 2007 and
replaced our agreement with Horizon. On April&nbsp;23, 2008, we announced that
we reached a mutual agreement with Republic on the terms under which Frontier
would reject the agreement.&#160; A structured
reduction and gradual phase-out of Republic&#146;s 12 aircraft from our daily
operation was completed in mid-June&nbsp;2008.&#160;
In the contractual obligations table above, only the amounts to be paid
during the negotiated wind-down period of approximately $7,600,000 are included.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;text-indent:.7pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">We also
lease office space, spare engines and office equipment for our headquarters and
airport facilities, and certain other equipment with expiration dates ranging
from 2008 to 2015.&#160; In addition, we lease
certain airport gate facilities and maintenance facilities on a month-to-month
basis.&#160; Amounts for leases that are on a
month-to-month basis are not included as an obligation in the table above.&#160; The table above also excludes lease payments
for a new headquarters building which we terminated during the bankruptcy
process in May&nbsp;2008.</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;text-indent:.7pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As
of March&nbsp;31, 2008, we have remaining firm purchase commitments for eight
additional aircraft from Airbus that have scheduled delivery dates beginning in
February&nbsp;2009 and continuing through November&nbsp;2011 and one remaining
firm purchase commitment for one spare Airbus engine scheduled for delivery in December&nbsp;2009.&#160; Included in the purchase obligations are the
remaining amounts due Airbus, amounts for spare aircraft components to support
the additional aircraft and&#160; remaining
new leather aircraft seats for one additional ship set yet to be
purchased.&#160; We are not under any
contractual obligations with respect to spare parts or the new aircraft seats.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have not
secured financing for the purchase of our remaining eight Airbus aircraft.&#160; To complete the purchase of the remaining
eight Airbus aircraft scheduled for delivery starting in February&nbsp;2009, we
must secure additional aircraft financing totaling approximately $280,000,000
assuming bank financing was used for these remaining aircraft.&#160;&#160;&#160; The terms of the purchase agreements do not
allow for cancellations of any of the purchase commitments.&#160; If we are unable to secure all the necessary financing
it could result in the loss of pre-delivery payments and deposits previously
paid to the manufacturers. We expect to finance these remaining </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">45</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">firm commitments
through various financing alternatives, including, but not limited to, domestic
and foreign bank financing, leveraged lease arrangements or sale/leaseback
transactions.&#160;&#160; There can be no
assurances that additional financing will be available when required or will be
on acceptable terms. Additionally, the terms of the purchase agreement with the
manufacturers would require us to pay penalties or damages in the event of any
breach of contract with our supplier, including possible termination of the
agreement.&#160; As of March&nbsp;31, 2008, we
had made pre-delivery payments on future aircraft deliveries totaling
$12,738,000 which relates to aircraft for which we have not secured financing.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(5)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October&nbsp;2002, we entered into a purchase and 12-year services
agreement with LiveTV to bring DIRECTV AIRBORNE&#153; satellite programming to every
seatback in our Airbus fleet.&#160; We intend
to install LiveTV in every new Airbus aircraft we place in service.&#160; The table above includes amounts for the
installation of DirecTV for the remaining eight Airbus aircraft we currently
expect to purchase. In January&nbsp;2008, we signed a hardware agreement under
which LiveTV agreed to repurchase LiveTV equipment installed and make payments
over a specified period for this equipment.&#160;
The table does not include payments to be received under our new
hardware agreement with LiveTV.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(6)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In March&nbsp;2004, we entered into a services agreement with Sabre,&nbsp;Inc.
for its SabreSonic</font><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#228;</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> passenger solution to power our reservations and check-in capabilities
along with a broad scope of technology for streamlining our operations and
improving revenue.&#160; The table above
includes minimum annual system usage fees.&#160;
Usage fees are based on passengers booked, and actual amounts paid may
be in excess of the minimum per the contract terms.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">46</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Commercial
Commitments<i>  </i>and Off-Balance Sheet
Arrangements</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Letters of Credit and Cash Deposits</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As we enter new markets,
increase the amount of space we lease, or add leased aircraft, we are often
required to provide the airport authorities and lessors with a letter of
credit, bond or cash security deposits.&#160;
We also provide letters of credit for our workers&#146; compensation
insurance.&#160; As of March&nbsp;31, 2008, we
had outstanding letters of credit, bonds and cash security deposits totaling
$21,939,000, $2,616,000 and $25,123,000, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We also have an agreement
with a financial institution where we can issue letters of credit of up to an
agreed upon percentage of spare parts inventories less amounts borrowed under
the credit facility.&#160; As of March&nbsp;31,
2008, we had $18,187,000 available under this facility. We have reduced the
amount available for borrowings by letters of credit issued of $14,560,000 and
cash draws of $3,000,000.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In July&nbsp;2005, we
entered into an additional agreement with another financial institution for a
$5,000,000 revolving line of credit that permits us to issue letters of credit
up to $3,500,000.&#160; In June&nbsp;2006, the
revolving line of credit was increased to $5,750,000 and it now permits us to
issue letters of credit up to $5,000,000 and matured in June&nbsp;2008.&#160; As of March&nbsp;31, 2008, we have utilized
$4,534,000 under this agreement for standby letters of credit that provide
credit support for certain facility leases.&#160;
In June&nbsp;2008,&nbsp;we entered into a&nbsp;stipulation with the
financial institution, which was approved by the bankruptcy court, and which
resulted in the financial institution releasing its liens on our working
capital in exchange for cash collateral.&nbsp; This stipulation also provided
for the issuance of new letters of credit going forward.&nbsp; The amount of
cash collateral required was for full cash collateralization of letters of
credit outstanding, less the $2,750,000 already cash secured.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have a contract with a
bankcard processor that requires a holdback of bankcard funds equal to a
certain percentage of our air traffic liability associated with the estimated
amount of bankcard transactions.&#160; As of March&nbsp;31,
2008, that amount totaled $54,500,000.&#160;
In June&nbsp;2008, we reached a revised agreement with this bankcard
processor that requires adjustments to the reserve account on a monthly basis
based on our current and projected air traffic liability associated with these
estimated bankcard transactions.&#160; As of June&nbsp;20,
2008, this revised agreement results in an increase to the holdback to
approximately $61,940,000.&#160; The Company
and the creditors committee continue to negotiate the terms of the revised
agreement.&#160; In addition, a credit card
company began a holdback during the fiscal year ending March&nbsp;31, 2008
which totaled $15,500,000 at March&nbsp;31, 2008.&#160; As of June&nbsp;20, 2008, our requirements
resulted in an increase to $22,655,000 for this credit card company.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We use the Airline
Reporting Corporation (&#147;ARC&#148;) to provide reporting and settlement services for
travel agency sales and other related transactions.&#160; In order to maintain the minimum bond (or
irrevocable letter of credit) coverage of $100,000, ARC requires participating
carriers to meet, on a quarterly basis, certain financial tests such as working
capital ratio and percentage of debt to debt plus equity.&#160; As of March&nbsp;31, 2008, we met these
financial tests and presently are only obligated to provide the minimum amount
of $100,000 in coverage to ARC.&#160; If we
fail the minimum testing requirements, we would be required to increase our
bonding coverage to four times the weekly agency net cash sales (sales net of
refunds and agency commissions). Based on net cash sales remitted to us for the
week ended June&nbsp;20, 2008, the bond coverage would be increased to
$5,985,000 if we failed the tests.&#160; If we
were unable to increase the bond amount as a result of our then financial
condition, we could be required to issue a letter of credit that would restrict
cash in an amount equal to the letter of credit.&#160; In May&nbsp;2008, ARC started requiring a
holdback which was equal to $1,280,000 as of June&nbsp;23, 2008.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Hedging Transactions</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In November&nbsp;2002, we initiated a fuel hedging
program using a variety of financial derivative instruments.&#160; These fuel hedges do not qualify for hedge
accounting under SFAS 144, and, as such, realized and non-cash mark to market
adjustments to the fair value of the hedge contracts, are included in aircraft
fuel expense.&#160; The results of operations
for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, 2007 and 2006 include non-cash mark to
market derivative gains/(losses) of $1,847,000, $12,753,000 and $(2,163,000),
respectively. Cash settlements for fuel derivatives contracts for the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, 2007, and 2006 were receipts of $30,740,000,
payments of $3,925,000, and receipts of $5,338,000, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Due to our Chapter 11 filing, all fuel hedge contracts outstanding as
of March&nbsp;31, 2008 were terminated in </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">47</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='47',FILE='C:\JMS\pmurali\08-16762-3\task3013036\16762-3-ba-09.htm',USER='105425',CD='Jul  1 01:50 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">May&nbsp;2008 and
subsequently settled which resulted in receipts of $23,409,000.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Maintenance Contracts</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective January&nbsp;1,
2003, we entered into an engine maintenance agreement with GE Engine Services,&nbsp;Inc.
(&#147;GE&#148;) covering the scheduled and unscheduled repair of our aircraft engines
used on most of our Airbus aircraft.&#160; The
agreement was subsequently modified and extended in September&nbsp;2004.&#160; The agreement is for a 12-year period from
the effective date for our owned aircraft or May&nbsp;1, 2019, whichever comes
first. For each leased aircraft, the term coincides with the initial lease term
of 12 years.&#160; This agreement precludes us
from using another third party for such services during the term.&#160; For owned aircraft, this agreement requires
monthly payments at a specified rate multiplied by the number of flight hours
the engines were operated during that month.&#160;
The costs under this agreement for our purchased aircraft for the years
ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, 2007 and 2006 were approximately $9,890,000,
$6,374,000 and $3,545,000, respectively.&#160;
Any unplanned maintenance expenses not otherwise covered by reserves are
paid by us.&#160; For our leased aircraft that
are covered by the agreement, we do not make the flight hour payments to GE
under the agreement; instead we make engine maintenance reserve payments which
are expensed as paid as required under the applicable lease agreements.&#160; At the time a leased engine makes a scheduled
maintenance shop visit, the lessors pay GE directly for the repair of aircraft
engines from reserve accounts established under the applicable lease
documents.&#160; To the extent actual maintenance
expenses incurred exceed these reserves, we are required to pay these amounts.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Fuel Consortia</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We participate in numerous fuel consortia with other carriers at major
airports to reduce the costs of fuel distribution and storage. Interline
agreements govern the rights and responsibilities of the consortia members and
provide for the allocation of the overall costs to operate the consortia based
on usage. The consortia (and in limited cases, the participating carriers) have
entered into long-term agreements to lease certain airport fuel storage and
distribution facilities that are typically financed through tax-exempt bonds
(either special facilities lease revenue bonds or general airport revenue
bonds), issued by various local municipalities. In general, each consortium
lease agreement requires the consortium to make lease payments in amounts
sufficient to pay the maturing principal and interest payments on the bonds. As
of March&nbsp;31, 2008, approximately $544,262,000 principal amount of such
bonds were secured by fuel facility leases at major hubs in which we
participate, as to which each of the signatory airlines has provided indirect
guarantees of the debt. Our exposure is approximately $23,811,000 principal
amount of such bonds based on our most recent consortia participation. Our
exposure could increase if the participation of other carriers decreases or if
other carriers default.&#160; The guarantees
will expire when the tax-exempt bonds are paid in full, which ranges from 2011
to 2033.&#160; We can exit any of our fuel
consortia agreements with limited penalties and certain advance notice
requirements. We have not recorded a liability on our consolidated balance
sheets related to these indirect guarantees.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Represented Employees</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2005,
our aircraft appearance agents signed a 10-year agreement.&#160; This employee group is represented by the
International Brotherhood of Teamsters (&#147;IBT&#148;).</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In March&nbsp;2006, our
material specialists voted for union representation by the IBT, affecting
approximately 22 employees.&#160; In September&nbsp;2007,
a four year agreement was reached between Frontier and the IBT, with an
economic re-opener in July&nbsp;2008, to correspond to the maintenance union
contract.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February&nbsp;2007, Frontier and the Frontier
Airline Pilots Association (&#147;FAPA&#148;) announced that FAPA membership ratified a
new collective bargaining agreement. The new four-year agreement amends the
previous five-year contract signed in May&nbsp;2000. Implementation of the
approved agreement began in March&nbsp;2007.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2007,
our dispatchers signed an amended five year collective bargaining agreement
with Frontier. The contract with our dispatchers, who are represented by the
Transport Workers Union (&#147;TWU&#148;), affects approximately 16 employees.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">48</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
