<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='48',FILE='C:\JMS\pmurali\08-16762-3\task3013036\16762-3-ba-09.htm',USER='105425',CD='Jul  1 01:50 2008' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Critical
Accounting Policies</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The preparation of financial statements in conformity
with U.S generally accepted accounting principles requires management to make
estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and
liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of
the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenue and expenses
during the reporting period.&#160; Actual
results could differ from those estimates.&#160;
As a result of the filing for Chapter 11, the realization of assets and
liquidation of liabilities are subject to uncertainty.&#160; A plan of reorganization could materially
change the amounts and classifications reported in the consolidated financial
statements, which do not give effect to any adjustments to the carrying value
of assets or amounts of liabilities as a consequence of confirmation of a plan
of reorganization.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Critical accounting policies are defined as those that
are both important to the portrayal of our financial condition and results, and
require management to exercise significant judgments.&#160; Our most critical accounting policies are
described briefly below.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Revenue Recognition</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Passenger tickets</font></i>
- - Passenger, cargo, and other revenue are recognized when the transportation is
provided or after the tickets expire, one year after date of issuance, and are
net of excise taxes, passenger facility charges and security fees.&#160; Revenue that have been deferred are included
in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets as air traffic liability.&#160; Included in passenger revenue are change fees
imposed on passengers for making schedule changes to non-refundable
tickets.&nbsp; Change fees are recognized as revenue at the time the change
fees are collected from the passenger as they are a separate transaction that
occurs subsequent to the date of the original ticket sale.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:31.5pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Taxes and Fees</font></i> &#150; We are required
to charge certain taxes and fees on our passenger tickets.&#160; These taxes and fees include U.S. federal
transportation taxes, federal security charges, airport passenger facility
charges and foreign arrival and departure taxes.&#160; These taxes and fees are legal assessments on
the customer, for which we have an obligation to act as a collection agent.&#160; Because we are not entitled to retain these
taxes and fees, such amounts are not included in passenger revenue.&#160; We record a liability when the amounts are
collected and reduce the liability when payments are made to the applicable
government agency or operating carrier.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:31.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Aircraft Maintenance</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We operate under an FAA-approved continuous inspection
and maintenance program.&#160; We account for
maintenance activities on the direct expense method.&#160; Under this method, major overhaul maintenance
costs are recognized as expense as maintenance services are performed, as
flight hours are flown for nonrefundable maintenance payments required by lease
agreements, and as the obligation is incurred for payments made under service
agreements.&#160; Routine maintenance and
repairs are charged to operations as incurred.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective January&nbsp;1, 2003, we executed a 12-year
engine services agreement with GE covering the scheduled and unscheduled repair
of Airbus engines.&#160; This agreement was
extended to May&nbsp;1, 2019 in September&nbsp;2004.&#160; Under the terms of the services agreement, we
agreed to pay GE an annual rate per-engine-hour, payable monthly, and GE
assumed the responsibility to overhaul our engines on Airbus aircraft as
required during the term of the services agreement, subject to certain
exclusions.&#160;&#160; We believe the rate
per-engine hour approximates the periodic cost we would have incurred to
service those engines.&#160; Accordingly,
these payments are expensed as the obligation is incurred.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Derivative Instruments</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We account for derivative financial instruments in
accordance with the provisions of Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No.&nbsp;133,
&#147;Accounting for Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activities&#148; (&#147;SFAS 133&#148;).&#160; SFAS 133 requires us to measure all
derivatives at fair value and to recognize them in the balance sheet as an
asset or liability.&#160; For derivatives
designated as cash flow hedges, changes in fair value of the derivative are
generally reported in other comprehensive income and are subsequently
reclassified into earnings when the hedged item affects earnings.&#160; Changes in fair value of derivative
instruments not designated as hedging instruments and ineffective portions of
hedges are recognized in earnings in the current period.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">49</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='49',FILE='C:\JMS\105451\08-16762-3\task3012860\16762-3-ba-11.htm',USER='105451',CD='Jul  1 00:57 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We enter into derivative instruments to hedge the
interest payments associated with a portion of our LIBOR-based borrowings and
fuel purchases.&#160; We designate certain
interest rate swaps as qualifying cash flow hedges.&#160; We also enter into derivative instruments to
reduce exposure to the effect of fluctuations in fuel prices.&#160; These transactions are accounted for as
trading instruments under SFAS 133.&#160; As a
result, we record these instruments at fair market value and recognize realized
and mark to market gains and losses in aircraft fuel expense.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Accounting for
long-lived assets</font></i></b><i>.</i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In accounting for long-lived assets, we make estimates about the
expected useful lives, projected residual values and the potential for
impairment.&#160; In estimating useful lives
and residual values of our aircraft, we have relied upon estimates from
industry experts as well as our anticipated utilization of the aircraft.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our long-lived assets are evaluated for impairment at least annually or
when events and circumstances indicate that the assets may be impaired.
Indicators include operating or cash flow losses, significant decreases in
market value or changes in technology.&#160;
All of our long-lived assets are relatively new and our aircraft are
actively deployed in our route system.&#160;
We have also recently sold aircraft in amounts in excess of their
carrying values.&#160; We have not identified
any significant impairments related to our long-lived assets at this time.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Customer Loyalty Program</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2001, we established <i>EarlyReturns</i></font><i>&#174;</i>, a frequent flyer
program to encourage travel on our airline and foster customer loyalty.&#160; We account for the <i>EarlyReturns</i><i>&#174;</i> program under the
incremental cost method whereby travel awards are valued at the incremental
cost of carrying one passenger based on expected redemptions.&#160; Those incremental costs are based on
expectations of expenses to be incurred on a per passenger basis and include
food and beverages, fuel, liability insurance, and ticketing costs.&#160; The incremental costs do not include
allocations of overhead expenses, salaries, aircraft cost or flight profit or
losses.&#160;&#160; We do not record a liability
for mileage earned by participants who have not reached the level to become
eligible for a free travel award.&#160; We do
not record a liability for the expected redemption of miles for non-travel
awards since the cost to us of these awards is negligible.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007, we estimated that
approximately 472,000 and 324,000 round-trip flight awards, respectively, were
eligible for redemption by <i>EarlyReturns</i></font><i>&#174;</i> members who have
mileage credits exceeding the 15,000-mile free round-trip domestic ticket award
threshold.&#160; As of March&nbsp;31, 2008 and
2007, we had recorded a liability of approximately $10,059,000 and $4,249,000,
respectively, for these rewards.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We sell points in <i>EarlyReturns</i></font><i>&#174;</i> to third
parties.&#160; The portion of the sale that is
for travel is deferred and recognized as passenger revenue when we estimate
transportation is provided.&#160; The
remaining portion, referred to as the marketing component, is recognized in the
month received and included in other revenue.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Co-Branded Credit Card Arrangement</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We entered into a co-branded credit card arrangement
with a MasterCard issuing bank in March&nbsp;2003.&#160; In May&nbsp;2007, this agreement was amended
to extend the contract to December&nbsp;2014 with enhanced financial terms.&#160; The terms of this affinity agreement provide
that we will receive a fixed fee for each new account, which varies based on
the type of account, and a percentage of the annual renewal fees that the bank
receives.&#160; We receive an increased fee
for new accounts solicited by us.&#160; We
also receive fees for the purchase of frequent flier miles awarded to the
credit card customers.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We account for all fees received under the co-branded
credit card program by allocating the fees between the portion that represents
the estimated value of the subsequent travel award to be provided, and the
portion which represents a marketing fee to cover marketing and other related
costs to administer the program.&#160; This
latter portion (referred to as the marketing component) represents the residual
after determining the value of the travel component.&#160; The component representing travel is
determined by reference to an equivalent restricted fare, which is used as a
proxy for the value of travel of a frequent flyer mileage award. The travel
component is deferred and recognized as revenue over the estimated usage period
of the frequent flyer mileage awards of 20 months.&#160; We have estimated the period over which the
frequent flier mileage awards will be used based on the history of usage of the
frequent flier mileage awards.&#160; We record
the marketing component of the revenue earned under this agreement in other
revenue in the month received.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">50</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='50',FILE='C:\JMS\105451\08-16762-3\task3012860\16762-3-ba-11.htm',USER='105451',CD='Jul  1 00:57 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, we received
total fees of $44,369,000.&#160; Of that
amount, $25,545,000 was deferred as the travel award component, with the
remaining marketing component of $18,824,000 recognized as other revenue. For
the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007, we received total fees of $36,917,000.&#160; Of that amount, $25,219,000 was deferred as
the travel award component, with the remaining marketing component of
$11,698,000 recognized as other revenue.&#160;
For the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2006, we received total fees of
$24,986,000.&#160; Of that amount, $19,686,000
was deferred as the travel award component, and the remaining marketing
component of $5,300,000 was recognized as other revenue.&#160; Amortization of deferred revenue recognized
in earnings during the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, 2007 and 2006 was
$24,789,000, $20,158,000 and $11,059,000, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Income Taxes</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We account for income taxes using the asset and
liability method.&#160; Under that method,
deferred income taxes are recognized for the tax consequences of &#147;temporary
differences&#148; by applying enacted statutory tax rates applicable to future years
to differences between the financial statement carrying amounts and tax bases
of existing assets and liabilities and net operating losses (&#147;NOL&#146;s&#148;) and tax
credit carryforwards.&#160; A valuation
allowance is provided to the extent that it is more likely than not that
deferred tax assets will not be realized.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, we
increased our valuation allowance for deferred tax assets by $21,418,000.&nbsp;
The ultimate realization of deferred tax assets is dependent upon the
generation of future taxable income during the periods in which those temporary
differences become deductible.&nbsp; We have a valuation allowance for all
deferred tax assets that are not realizable through the reversal of existing
taxable temporary differences since it is more likely that not that these
benefits would not be realized due to concerns about our ability to continue as
a going concern.&nbsp; The NOL&#146;s that have been generated are due in large part
to the accelerated depreciation over a shorter useful life for tax
purposes.&nbsp;&nbsp; Our ability to deduct net operating loss carryforwards
could be subject to a significant limitation if we were to undergo an &#147;ownership
change&#148; for purposes of Section&nbsp;382 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986,
as amended, during or as a result of our Chapter&nbsp;11 proceedings.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Self-Insurance</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
are self insured for the majority of our group health insurance costs, subject
to specific retention levels.&#160; We rely on
claims experience and the advice of consulting actuaries and administrators in
determining an adequate liability for self-insurance claims.&#160; Our self-insurance healthcare liability
represents our estimate of claims that have been incurred but not reported as
of March&nbsp;31, 2008.&#160; This liability,
which totaled $2,061,000 at March&nbsp;31, 2008, was estimated based on our
claims experience.&#160; We determine the
actual average claims cost per employee and the number of days between the
incurrence of a claim and the date it is paid.&#160;
The estimate of our liability for employee healthcare represents our
estimate of unreported claims with an increase in claims based on trend
factors.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
are also self-insured for the majority of our workers&#146; compensation
expenses.&#160; Our liability for workers&#146;
compensation claims is the estimated total cost of the claims on a
fully-developed basis, up to a maximum amount, based on reserves for these
claims that are established by a third-party administrator.&#160; The liability at March&nbsp;31, 2008 totaled
$6,023,000.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">While
we believe that the estimate of our self-insurance liabilities are reasonable,
significant differences in our experience or a significant change in any of our
assumptions could materially affect the amount of healthcare and workers
compensation expenses we have recorded.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Stock-Based Compensation</font></i></b><i>.</i></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">We estimate the fair value of stock options and stock appreciation
rights granted using the Black-Scholes-Merton option pricing model and the
assumptions shown in Note 14 to our consolidated financial statements. We
estimate the expected term of options granted using our historical exercise
patterns, which we believe are representative of future exercise behavior.&#160; We estimate volatility of our common stock
using the historical closing prices of our common stock using the period equal
to the expected term of the options, which we believe is representative of the
future behavior of our common stock. Our risk-free interest rate assumption is
determined using the Federal Reserve nominal rates for U.S. Treasury
zero-coupon bonds with maturities similar to those of the expected term of the
award being valued. We have never paid any cash dividends on our common stock
and we do </font></i></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">51</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">not anticipate paying any cash dividends in the foreseeable future.
Therefore, we assumed an expected dividend yield of zero. Stock-based
compensation expense for restricted stock units (&#147;RSU&#148;) are based on the fair
value of our common stock on the date of grant and is amortized over the
vesting period, generally five years. Each RSU is settled in shares of our
common stock after the vesting period. We record stock-based compensation
expense only for those options and awards expected to vest using an estimated
forfeiture rate based on our historical pre-vesting forfeiture data and
periodically will revise those estimates in subsequent periods if actual
forfeitures differ from those estimates.</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:37.4pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">New
Accounting Standards Not Yet Adopted</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2006,
the FASB issued Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No.&nbsp;157, <i>Fair Value Measurements</i>, (&#147;FAS 157&#148;). FAS 157 defines fair
value, establishes a framework for measuring fair value in generally accepted
accounting principles and expands disclosures about fair value measurements.
FAS 157 is effective for financial statements issued for fiscal years beginning
after November&nbsp;15, 2007 and interim periods within those fiscal years. We do not believe
the adoption of FAS 157 will result in a material cumulative effect adjustment
on our consolidated financial statements when adopted on April&nbsp;1, 2008.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February&nbsp;2007,
the FASB issued Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No.&nbsp;159<i>, The Fair Value Option for Financial Assets and Financial Liabilities </i>(&#147;FAS
159&#148;). FAS 159 permits companies to choose to measure many financial instruments
and certain other items at fair value, following the provisions of SFAS No.&nbsp;157.
FAS 159 is effective for fiscal years beginning after November&nbsp;15, 2007.
We have not yet determined the impact of adopting FAS 159.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In March 2008, the FASB issued Statement of Financial
Accounting Standards No. 161, <i>Disclosures about
Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activities - an Amendment of FASB Statement
133</i> (&#147;FAS 161&#148;). This standard enhances required disclosures
regarding derivatives and hedging activities to help investors better
understand how derivative instruments and hedging activities affect an entity&#146;s
financial position, financial performance and cash flows.&#160; Requirements under FAS 161 include disclosure
of the objectives for using derivative instruments, disclosure of the fair
values of derivative instruments and their gains and losses in a tabular
format, disclosure of credit risk related features, and cross-referencing
within the footnotes of derivative-related information.&#160; FAS 161 is effective for fiscal years and
interim periods beginning after November 15, 2008. The Company expects to
comply with the disclosure provision of adopting FAS 161 upon adoption.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">52</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 7A:&#160;
Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk</font></b><a name="Item7aQuantitativeAndQualitativeD_221300"></a></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Aircraft Fuel</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our earnings are affected by changes in the price and availability of
aircraft fuel.&#160; Market risk is estimated
as a hypothetical 10 percent change in the average cost per gallon of fuel for
the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008.&#160;
Based on actual fuel usage for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, such
a change would have had the effect of increasing or decreasing our total
aircraft fuel expense by approximately $53,920,000, excluding the benefit of
our fuel hedging.&#160; Comparatively, based
on our total projected fleet after capacity reductions in fiscal year 2009,
this would have the effect of increasing or decreasing our aircraft fuel
expense in fiscal year 2009 by approximately $42,700,000 measured as of March&nbsp;31,
2008, excluding the effects of our fuel hedging arrangements which were settled
in May&nbsp;2008.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our results of operations for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2008 include cash settlements on fuel derivative contracts of $30,740,000
recorded as a decrease to fuel expense and non-cash mark to market gains of
$1,847,000 recorded as a decrease in fuel expense with respect to fuel hedging
agreements.&#160; As of March&nbsp;31, 2008,
the fair value of the hedge agreements recorded on the balance sheet as an
asset was $15,576,000.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:28.05pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Due to our Chapter 11 filing, all fuel hedge contracts outstanding as
of March&nbsp;31, 2008 were terminated in May&nbsp;2008 and subsequently
settled which resulted in receipts of $23,409,000.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Interest</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are susceptible to market risk associated with changes in variable
interest rates on long-term debt obligations we incurred and will incur to
finance the purchases of our Airbus aircraft.&#160;
Interest expense on 74.3% of our outstanding debt at March&nbsp;31, 2008
is subject to interest rate adjustments every three to six months based upon
changes in the applicable LIBOR rate.&#160; A
change in the base LIBOR rate of 100 basis points (1.0%) would have the effect
of increasing or decreasing our annual interest expense by $4,941,000 assuming
the loans outstanding that are subject to interest rate adjustments at March&nbsp;31,
2008 totaling $494,119,000 are outstanding for the entire period.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">53</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='53',FILE='C:\JMS\105451\08-16762-3\task3012860\16762-3-ba-11.htm',USER='105451',CD='Jul  1 00:57 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 8:&#160;
Financial Statements and Supplementary Data</font></b><a name="Item8FinancialStatementsAndSupple_221312"></a></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our consolidated
financial statements are filed as a part of this report immediately following
the signature page.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
9:&#160; Changes in and Disagreements with
Accountants on Accounting and Financial Disclosure</font></b><a name="Item9ChangesInAndDisagreementsWit_221316"></a></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Not applicable.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 9A:&#160; Controls and
Procedures</font></b><a name="Item9aControlsAndProcedures_221319"></a></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Disclosure
Controls and Procedures</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our management,
with the participation of our Chief Executive Officer and acting Chief
Financial Officer, evaluated the effectiveness of our disclosure controls and
procedures (as defined in Rule&nbsp;13a-15(e)&nbsp;under the Securities
Exchange Act of 1934, as amended) as of March&nbsp;31, 2008. Based on that
evaluation, the Chief Executive Officer and Principal Financial Officer
concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures were effective to ensure
that the information required to be disclosed by us in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K
was recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time periods
specified in the SEC&#146;s rules&nbsp;and instructions for Form&nbsp;10-K.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Management&#146;s
Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our management is
responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over
financial reporting (as defined in Rule&nbsp;13a-15(f)&nbsp;under the Exchange
Act). Under the supervision and with the participation of our management,
including our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, we conducted
an evaluation of the effectiveness of our internal control over financial
reporting based on the framework in Internal Control &#150; Integrated Framework
issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway
Commission.&#160; Based on that evaluation,
our management concluded that our internal control over financial reporting was
effective as of March&nbsp;31, 2008.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Frontier Airlines
Holdings,&nbsp;Inc.&#146;s independent registered public accounting firm has issued
an audit report on the effectiveness of the Company&#146;s internal control over
financial reporting.&#160; That report has
been included herein.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Changes
in Internal Control</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:22.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There were no changes in our internal control over financial reporting
identified in connection with the evaluation of our controls performed during
the quarter ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 that have materially affected, or are
reasonably likely to materially affect, our internal control over financial
reporting.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:22.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
9B. Other Information</font></b><a name="Item9b_OtherInformation_221339"></a></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:22.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On June&nbsp;27, 2008, Mr.&nbsp;Edward M. Christie,&nbsp;III was
appointed as the Chief Financial Officer for Frontier Airlines Holdings,&nbsp;Inc.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Christie has held several positions
in the Company since joining the finance department in December&nbsp;2002, most
recently serving as the Company&#146;s Senior Vice President &#150; Finance.&#160; Prior to joining Frontier, Mr.&nbsp;Christie
served as Vice President - Finance at a Denver asset-based finance
institution.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Christie is 37
years old and holds a Bachelor&#146;s degree in Business Administration - Finance
from the University of Arizona.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">54</font></p>

of Ethics</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  Agreement between Continental Airlines,&nbsp;Inc. and the Company.
  (Exhibit&nbsp;10.43 to the Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the
  year ended March&nbsp;31, 1999).</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="13%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:13.84%;">

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.92%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="84%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:84.24%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Second Amendment
  to Space and Use Agreement between Continental Airlines,&nbsp;Inc. and the
  Company. Portions of this Exhibit&nbsp;have been omitted and filed separately
  with the Securities and Exchange Commission in a confidential treatment
  request under Rule&nbsp;24b-2 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as
  amended (Exhibit&nbsp;10.3(a)&nbsp;to the Company&#146;s Annual Report on
  Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2003).</font></p>
  </td>

  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

 <tr>
  <td width="13%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:13.84%;">

  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft Lease

  Agreements that are substantially identical in all material respects to this

  with the Securities and Exchange Commission in a confidential treatment
  request under Rule&nbsp;24b-2 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as
  amended. (Exhibit&nbsp;10.24 to the Company&#146;s Quarterly Report on
  Form&nbsp;10-Q for the quarter ended December&nbsp;31, 2003).</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.92%;">

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Association,
  as Trustee (Exhibit&nbsp;4.1 to Amendment No.&nbsp;1 to Frontier&#146;s
  Registration Statement on Form&nbsp;S-3, File No.&nbsp;333-128407, filed on
  November&nbsp;23, 2005).</font></p>

  Supplemental Indenture dated December&nbsp;7, 2005, by and between Frontier

  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">+</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="94%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:94.88%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Management contract or compensatory plan or
  arrangement.</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">SIGNATURES</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to the
requirements of Section&nbsp;13 or 15(d)&nbsp;of the Securities Exchange Act of
1934, the registrant has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by
the undersigned, thereunto duly authorized.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="49%" colspan="2" valign="top" style="border:none;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:49.76%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Jeffery S. Potter, Director</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="50%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:50.24%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="49%" colspan="2" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:49.76%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="50%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:50.24%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Date: June&nbsp;30, 2008</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="49%" colspan="2" valign="top" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:49.76%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">By: /s/ Robert D. Taylor</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="50%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:50.24%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="49%" colspan="2" valign="top" style="border:none;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:49.76%;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">61</font></p>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='61',FILE='C:\JMS\105451\08-16762-3\task3012860\16762-3-ba-11.htm',USER='105451',CD='Jul  1 00:57 2008' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Report of
Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board of
Directors and Stockholders</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Frontier Airlines
Holdings,&nbsp;Inc. :</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance
sheets of Frontier Airlines Holdings,&nbsp;Inc. and subsidiaries (Debtors-In-Possession
as of April&nbsp;10, 2008) (the&nbsp;Company) as of March&nbsp;31, 2008 and
2007, and the related consolidated statements of operations, stockholders&#146;
equity and other comprehensive income (loss), and cash flows for each of the
years in the three-year period ended March&nbsp;31, 2008. These consolidated
financial statements are the responsibility of the Company&#146;s management. Our
responsibility is to express an opinion on these consolidated financial
statements based on our audits.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We conducted our audits in accordance with the
standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States).
Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable
assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material
misstatement. An audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting
the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements. An audit also includes
assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by
management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement presentation.
We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In our opinion, the consolidated financial statements
referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the financial
position of Frontier Airlines Holdings,&nbsp;Inc. and subsidiaries
(Debtors-In-Possession as of April&nbsp;10, 2008) as of March&nbsp;31, 2008 and
2007, and the results of their operations and their cash flows for each of the
years in the three-year period ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, in conformity with
U.S.&nbsp;generally accepted accounting principles.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The accompanying consolidated financial statements
have been prepared assuming that the Company will continue as a going concern.
As discussed in note&nbsp;1 to the consolidated financial statements, the
Company filed petitions for reorganization under Chapter&nbsp;11 of Title 11 of
the United States Code (the&nbsp;Bankruptcy Code), and this raises substantial
doubt about the Company&#146;s ability to continue as a going concern. Management&#146;s
plan concerning this matter is also discussed in note&nbsp;1 to the
consolidated financial statements. The consolidated financial statements do not
include adjustments that might result from the outcome of this uncertainty.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As discussed in note&nbsp;2 to the consolidated
financial statements, the Company adopted the provisions of Financial
Accounting Standards Board (FASB) Interpretation No.&nbsp;48, <i>Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes, an interpretation of
FASB&nbsp;No.&nbsp;109</i>, effective April&nbsp;1, 2007, and the
provisions of FASB&nbsp;No.&nbsp;123(R), <i>Share-Based Payment</i>,
effective April&nbsp;1, 2006.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We also have audited, in accordance with the standards
of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), Frontier
Airlines Holdings,&nbsp;Inc.&#146;s internal control over financial reporting as of March&nbsp;31,
2008, based on criteria established in <i>Internal Control &#150;
Integrated Framework</i> issued by the Committee of Sponsoring
Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO), and our report dated June&nbsp;27,
2008 expressed an unqualified opinion on the effectiveness of the Company&#146;s
internal control over financial reporting.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">/s/ KPMG LLP</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Denver, Colorado<br>
June&nbsp;27, 2008</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-1</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-1',FILE='C:\JMS\ssenthi\08-16762-3\task3012506\16762-3-ba-13.htm',USER='105271',CD='Jun 30 22:38 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting
Firm</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board of
Directors and Stockholders<br>
Frontier Airlines Holdings,&nbsp;Inc.:</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have audited Frontier Airlines Holdings,&nbsp;Inc.
and subsidiaries&#146; (Debtors-In-Possession as of April&nbsp;10, 2008)
(the&nbsp;Company) internal control over financial reporting as of March&nbsp;31,
2008, based on criteria established in <i>Internal Control &#150;
Integrated</i>  <i>Framework</i>
issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission
(COSO). Frontier Airlines Holdings,&nbsp;Inc.&#146;s management is responsible for
maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting and for its
assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting,
included in the accompanying Management&#146;s Annual Report on Internal Control
over Financial Reporting. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the Company&#146;s
internal control over financial reporting based on our audit.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We conducted our audit in accordance with the
standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States).
Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable
assurance about whether effective internal control over financial reporting was
maintained in all material respects. Our audit included obtaining an
understanding of internal control over financial reporting, assessing the risk
that a material weakness exists, and testing and evaluating the design and
operating effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk. Our
audit also included performing such other procedures as we considered necessary
in the circumstances. We believe that our audit provides a reasonable basis for
our opinion.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting
is a process designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability
of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external
purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles. A company&#146;s
internal control over financial reporting includes those policies and
procedures that (1)&nbsp;pertain to the maintenance of records that, in
reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and
dispositions of the assets of the company; (2)&nbsp;provide reasonable
assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of
financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting
principles, and that receipts and expenditures of the company are being made
only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the
company; and (3)&nbsp;provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or
timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the
company&#146;s assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Because of its inherent limitations, internal control
over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements. Also, projections
of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods are subject to the risk
that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that
the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In our opinion, Frontier Airlines Holdings,&nbsp;Inc.
(Debtors-In-Possession as of April&nbsp;10, 2008) maintained, in all material
respects, effective internal control over financial reporting as of March&nbsp;31,
2008, based on criteria established in <i>Internal Control &#150;
Integrated Framework</i> issued by the Committee of Sponsoring
Organizations of the Treadway Commission.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We also have audited, in accordance with the standards
of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), the
consolidated balance sheets of Frontier Airlines Holdings,&nbsp;Inc. and
subsidiaries as of March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007, and the related consolidated
statements of operations, stockholders&#146; equity and other comprehensive income
(loss), and cash flows for each of the years in the three-year period ended March&nbsp;31,
2008, and our report dated June&nbsp;27, 2008 expressed an unqualified opinion
on those consolidated financial statements, and included an explanatory
paragraph related to the Company&#146;s ability to continue as a going concern.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">/s/ KPMG LLP</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Denver, Colorado<br>
June&nbsp;27, 2008</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-2</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor
and Debtor-in-Possession as of April&nbsp;10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Consolidated
Balance Sheets</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">March&nbsp;31,
2008 and 2007</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(In thousands, except share data)</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">

and Debtor-in-Possession as of April&nbsp;10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER
AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor
and Debtor-in-Possession as of April&nbsp;10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Consolidated Statements of Stockholders&#146; Equity
and Other Comprehensive Income (Loss<a name="ConsolidatedStatementsOfStockhold_214054"></a>)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Years
Ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, 2007 and 2006</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(In
thousands, except shares)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.2%;">

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.2%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.2%;">

  </td>
