<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-6',FILE='C:\JMS\ssenthi\08-16762-3\task3012506\16762-3-ba-13.htm',USER='105271',CD='Jun 30 22:38 2008' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER
AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor
and Debtor-in-Possession as of April&nbsp;10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to
the Consolidated Financial Statements</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">March&nbsp;31,
2007</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b>Chapter 11 Reorganization</b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April&nbsp;10, 2008 (the &#147;Petition
Date&#148;), Frontier Airlines Holdings,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;Frontier Holdings&#148;) and its
subsidiaries Frontier Airlines,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;Frontier Airlines&#148;) and Lynx
Aviation,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;Lynx Aviation&#148;) filed voluntary petitions for
reorganization under Chapter&nbsp;11 of Title 11 of the United States Code (the
&#147;Bankruptcy Code&#148;) in the United States Bankruptcy Court for the Southern
District of New York (the &#147;Bankruptcy Court&#148;).&#160;
The cases are being jointly administered under Case No.&nbsp;08-11298
(RDD). Frontier Holdings, Frontier Airlines, and Lynx Aviation (collectively
the &#147;Debtors&#148; or the &#147;Company&#148;) will continue to operate as &#147;debtors-in-possession&#148;
under the jurisdiction of the Bankruptcy Court and in accordance with the
applicable provisions of the Bankruptcy Code and orders of the Bankruptcy
Court. In general, as debtors-in-possession, the Debtors are authorized under
Chapter&nbsp;11 to continue to operate as an ongoing business, but may not
engage in transactions outside of the ordinary course of business without the
prior approval of the Bankruptcy Court.&#160;
No assurance can be provided as to what values, if any, will be ascribed
in the Debtors&#146; bankruptcy proceedings to the Debtors&#146; pre-petition
liabilities, common stock and other securities. The Company believes its
currently outstanding common stock will have no value and will be canceled
under any plan of reorganization it might propose and that the value of the
Debtors&#146; various pre-petition liabilities and other securities is highly
speculative. Accordingly, caution should be exercised with respect to existing
and future investments in any of these liabilities or securities.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Reporting Requirements</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of its bankruptcy filing, the Company is now periodically
required to file various documents with and provide certain information to, the
Bankruptcy Court, including statements of financial affairs, schedules of
assets and liabilities, and monthly operating reports in forms prescribed by
federal bankruptcy law, as well as certain financial information on an
unconsolidated basis. Such materials will be prepared according to requirements
of federal bankruptcy law.&#160; While they
accurately provide then-current information required under federal bankruptcy
law, they are nonetheless unconsolidated, unaudited, and are prepared in a
format different from that used in Frontier Holdings consolidated financial
statements filed under the securities laws.&#160;
Accordingly, the Company believes that the substance and format do not
allow meaningful comparison with its regular publicly-disclosed consolidated
financial statements.&#160; Moreover, the materials
filed with the Bankruptcy Court are not prepared for the purpose of providing a
basis for an investment decision relating to the Company&#146;s securities, or for
comparison with other financial information filed with the Securities and
Exchange Commission (&#147;SEC&#148;).</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Reasons for Bankruptcy</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Debtors&#146; Chapter 11 filings followed an
unexpected attempt by the Company&#146;s principal credit card processor in April&nbsp;2008
to substantially increase a &#147;holdback&#148; of customer receipts from the sale of
tickets.&#160; This change in established
practices would have represented a material negative change to the Debtors&#146;
cash forecasts and business plan, put severe restraints on the Debtors&#146;
liquidity and made it impossible for the Debtors to continue normal
operations.&#160; Due to historically high
aircraft fuel prices, continued low passenger mile yields, cash holdbacks
instituted by the Company&#146;s other credit card processor, and the threatened
increased holdback from the Company&#146;s principal credit card processor, the
Company determined that the Debtors could not continue to operate without the
protections provided by</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-7</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-7',FILE='C:\JMS\105627\08-16762-3\task3012967\16762-3-ba-15.htm',USER='105627',CD='Jul  1 01:30 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession
as of April 10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to the Consolidated
Financial Statements, continued</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Chapter&nbsp;11.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">First Day Orders</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Bankruptcy Court has approved various
motions for various relief designed to allow the Debtors to continue normal
operations.&#160; The Bankruptcy Court&#146;s
orders authorize the Debtors, among other things, in their discretion to: (a)&nbsp;pay
certain pre-petition and post-petition employee wages, salaries, benefits and
other employee obligations; (b)&nbsp;pay vendors and other providers in the
ordinary course for goods and services received from and after the Petition
Date; (c)&nbsp;honor customer service programs, including the <i>Early Returns</i> frequent flyer program and our ticketing
programs; (d)&nbsp;honor certain obligations arising prior to the Petition Date
related to our interline, clearinghouse, code sharing and other similar
agreements; and (e)&nbsp;continue maintenance of existing bank accounts and
existing cash management systems.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Notifications</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Shortly after the Petition
Date, the Debtors began notifying all known current or potential creditors of
the Chapter&nbsp;11 filing. Subject to certain exceptions under the Bankruptcy
Code, the Debtors&#146; Chapter&nbsp;11 filing automatically enjoined, or stayed,
the continuation of any judicial or administrative proceedings or other actions
against the Debtors or their property to recover on, collect or secure a claim
arising prior to the Petition Date. Thus, for example, most creditor actions to
obtain possession of property from the Debtors, or to create, perfect or
enforce any lien against the property of the Debtors, or to collect on monies
owed or otherwise exercise rights or remedies with respect to a pre-petition
claim are enjoined unless and until the Bankruptcy Court lifts the automatic
stay. Vendors are being paid for goods furnished and services provided after
the Petition Date in the ordinary course of business.&#160; The deadline for the filing of proofs of
claims against the Debtors in these cases has yet to be established by the
Bankruptcy Court.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Creditors&#146; Committee</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As required by the
Bankruptcy Code, the United States Trustee for the Southern District of New
York appointed an official committee of unsecured creditors (the &#147;Creditors&#146;
Committee&#148;).&#160; The Creditors&#146; Committee
and its legal representatives have a right to be heard on all matters that come
before the Bankruptcy Court with respect to the Debtors.&#160; The Creditors&#146; Committee has been generally
supportive of the Debtors&#146; positions on various matters; however, there can be
no assurance that the Creditors&#146; Committee will support the Debtors&#146; positions
on matters to be presented to the Bankruptcy Court in the future or on any plan
of reorganization, once proposed.&#160;&#160;
Disagreements between the Debtors and the Creditors&#146; Committee could
protract the Chapter&nbsp;11 proceedings, negatively impact the Debtors&#146;
ability to operate and delay the Debtors&#146; emergence from the Chapter&nbsp;11
proceedings.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Executory Contracts &#150; Section&nbsp;365</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under Section&nbsp;365 and
other relevant sections of the Bankruptcy Code, the Debtors may assume, assume
and assign, or reject certain executory contracts and unexpired leases,
including, without limitation, leases of real property, aircraft and aircraft
engines, subject to the approval of the Bankruptcy Court and certain other
conditions. Any description of an executory contract or unexpired lease in this
Form&nbsp;10-K, including where applicable the Debtors&#146; express termination
rights or a quantification of our obligations, must be read in conjunction
with, and is qualified by, any overriding rejection rights the Debtors have
under Section&nbsp;365 of the Bankruptcy Code.&#160;
As of the date of this filing, the Company&#146;s most significant</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-8</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession
as of April 10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to the Consolidated
Financial Statements, continued</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">executory contracts rejected
include the Republic Airlines,&nbsp;Inc. regional partner contract as discussed
in Note 2 and the contract for a new headquarters building.&#160; Claims may arise as a result of rejecting any
executory contract.&#160; These financial
statements do no include the effects of any future claims.&#160; Certain claims filed may have priority above
unsecured creditors.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Secured Debtors Rights &#150; Section&nbsp;1110</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notwithstanding the general
discussion above of the impact of the automatic stay, under Section&nbsp;1110
of the Bankruptcy Code (&#147;Section&nbsp;1110&#148;), certain secured parties, lessors
and conditional sales vendors may have extra rights regarding taking possession
of certain qualifying aircraft, aircraft engines and other aircraft-related
equipment that are leased or subject to a security interest or conditional sale
contract pursuant to their agreement with the Debtors. Section&nbsp;1110
provides that, unless the Debtors agree to perform under the agreement and cure
all defaults within 60&nbsp;days after the Petition Date, such financing party
can take possession of such equipment.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;1110
effectively shortens the automatic stay period to 60&nbsp;days with respect to Section&nbsp;1110-eligible
aircraft, engines and related equipment subject to the following two
conditions. First, the debtor may extend the 60-day period by agreement of the
relevant financier, with court approval. Alternatively, the debtor may agree,
with Bankruptcy Court approval, to perform all of the obligations under the
applicable financing and cure any defaults thereunder as required by the
Bankruptcy Code (which does not preclude later rejecting any related
lease).&#160; On June&nbsp;9, 2008, the
Debtors agreed to perform their obligations under the applicable financings,
and the Debtors believe they have cured the defaults under these
financings.&#160; the Debtors have resolved
all cure issues with a majority of their aircraft financiers.&#160; The Debtors are, however, negotiating with
respect to a few remaining aircraft obligations, primarily related to their
Airbus 318 aircraft, and the ultimate outcome of these negotiations cannot be
predicted with certainty. To the extent the Debtors are unable to reach
agreements with these aircraft financiers, those parties may seek to take
action with respect to the related aircraft.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Plan of Reorganization</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In order to successfully
exit Chapter&nbsp;11, the Debtors will need to propose, and obtain confirmation
by the Bankruptcy Court of a plan of reorganization that satisfies the
requirements of the Bankruptcy Code. A plan of reorganization would, among
other things, resolve the Debtors&#146; pre-petition obligations, set forth the
revised capital structure of the newly reorganized entity and provide for
corporate governance subsequent to exit from bankruptcy.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Debtors have the
exclusive right for 120&nbsp;days after the Petition Date to file a plan of
reorganization and, if we do so, 60&nbsp;additional days to obtain necessary
acceptances of our plan.&#160; The Debtors
will likely file one or more motions to request extensions of these time periods.&#160; If the Debtors&#146; exclusivity period lapsed,
any party in interest would be able to file a plan of reorganization for any of
the Debtors.&#160; In addition to being voted
on by holders of impaired claims and equity interests, a plan of reorganization
must satisfy certain requirements of the Bankruptcy Code and must be approved,
or confirmed, by the Bankruptcy Court in order to become effective.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A plan of reorganization has
been accepted by holders of claims against and equity interests in the Debtors
if (1)&nbsp;at least one-half in number and two-thirds in dollar amount of
claims actually voting in each impaired class of claims have voted to accept
the plan and (2)&nbsp;at least two-thirds in amount of equity interests
actually voting in each impaired class of equity interests has voted to accept
the plan.&#160; Under certain circumstances
set forth in Section&nbsp;1129(b)&nbsp;of the Bankruptcy Code, however, the
Bankruptcy</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-9</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-9',FILE='C:\JMS\105627\08-16762-3\task3012967\16762-3-ba-15.htm',USER='105627',CD='Jul  1 01:30 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession
as of April 10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to the Consolidated
Financial Statements, continued</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Court may confirm a plan
even if such plan has not been accepted by all impaired classes of claims and
equity interests. A class of claims or equity interests that does not receive
or retain any property under the plan on account of such claims or interests is
deemed to have voted to reject the plan. The precise requirements and
evidentiary showing for confirming a plan notwithstanding its rejection by one
or more impaired classes of claims or equity interests depends upon a number of
factors, including the status and seniority of the claims or equity interests
in the rejecting class (i.e., secured claims or unsecured claims, subordinated
or senior claims, preferred or common stock). Generally, with respect to common
stock interests, a plan may be &#147;crammed down&#148; even if the shareowners receive
no recovery if the proponent of the plan demonstrates that (1)&nbsp;no class
junior to the common stock is receiving or retaining property under the plan
and (2)&nbsp;no class of claims or interests senior to the common stock is
being paid more than in full.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The timing of filing a plan
of reorganization by the Debtors will depend on the timing and outcome of
numerous other ongoing matters in the Chapter&nbsp;11 proceedings.&#160; There can be no assurance at this time that a
plan of reorganization will be confirmed by the Bankruptcy Court, or that any
such plan will be implemented successfully.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Reorganization Costs</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Debtors have incurred
and will continue to incur significant costs associated with our
reorganization. The amount of these costs, which are being expensed as
incurred, are expected to significantly affect the Debtors&#146; results of
operations.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the priority scheme
established by the Bankruptcy Code, unless creditors agree otherwise,
pre-petition liabilities and post-petition liabilities must be satisfied in
full before stockholders are entitled to receive any distribution or retain any
property under a plan of reorganization. The ultimate recovery to creditors
and/or stockholders, if any, will not be determined until confirmation of a
plan or plans of reorganization. No assurance can be given as to what values,
if any, will be ascribed in the Chapter&nbsp;11 cases to each of these constituencies
or what types or amounts of distributions, if any, they would receive. A plan
of reorganization could result in holders of the Debtors&#146; liabilities and/or
securities, including the Company&#146;s common stock receiving no distribution on
account of their interests and cancellation of their holdings. As discussed
above, if the requirements of Section&nbsp;1129(b)&nbsp;of the Bankruptcy Code
are met, a plan of reorganization can be confirmed notwithstanding its
rejection by the holders of the Company&#146;s common stock and notwithstanding the
fact that such holders do not receive or retain any property on account of
their equity interests under the plan. Because of such possibilities, the value
of the Debtors&#146; liabilities and securities, including the Company&#146;s common
stock is highly speculative. The Debtors urge that appropriate caution be
exercised with respect to existing and future investments in any of the
liabilities and/or securities of the Debtors.&#160;
Furthermore, as discussed above, at this time there is no assurance the
Debtors will be able to restructure as a going concern or successfully propose,
or implement a plan of reorganization.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Since the April&nbsp;10,
2008 bankruptcy filing subsequent to yearend, the Company incurred, and will
continue to incur, significant costs associated with the reorganization. The
amount of these costs, which are being expensed as incurred, are expected to
significantly affect the results of operations.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Risks and Uncertainties</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of the Petition Date, the
Company had in excess of $108 million in unrestricted cash, cash equivalents
and short-term investments. The ability of the Company, both during and after
the Chapter 11 case, to</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-10</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-10',FILE='C:\JMS\105627\08-16762-3\task3012967\16762-3-ba-15.htm',USER='105627',CD='Jul  1 01:30 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession
as of April 10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to the Consolidated
Financial Statements, continued</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">continue as a going-concern
is dependent upon, among other things, (i)&nbsp;the ability of the Company to
successfully achieve required cost savings to complete its restructuring; (ii)&nbsp;the
ability of the Company to maintain adequate liquidity; (iii)&nbsp;the ability
of the Company to generate cash from operations; (iv)&nbsp;the ability of the
Company to secure Debtor in Possession Financing; </font>(v)&nbsp;to negotiate favorable terms with our bankcard processors and credit
card companies;&#160; (vi)&nbsp;
the ability of the Company to confirm a plan of reorganization under the
Bankruptcy Code; and (vii)&nbsp;the Company&#146;s ability to achieve profitability.
Uncertainty as to the outcome of these factors raises substantial doubt about
the Company&#146;s ability to continue as a going-concern. The accompanying
consolidated financial statements do not include any adjustments to reflect or
provide for the consequences of the bankruptcy proceedings.&#160; In particular such financial statements do
not purport to show (a)&nbsp;as to assets, their realization value on a
liquidation basis or their availability to satisfy liabilities; (b)&nbsp; as to
pre-petition liabilities, the amounts that may be allowed for claims or
contingencies, or the status and priority thereof; (c)&nbsp;as to stockholder
accounts, the effect of any changes that may be made in the capitalization of
the Company; or (d)&nbsp;as to operations, the effects of any changes that may
be made in its business.&#160; A plan of
reorganization could materially change the amounts currently disclosed in the
consolidated financial statements.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The negative events or publicity associated with
the Debtor&#146;s Chapter&nbsp;11 proceedings could adversely affect sales of
tickets and the relationship with customers, as well as with vendors and
employees, which in turn could adversely affect the Debtor&#146;s operations and
financial condition, particularly if the Chapter&nbsp;11 proceedings are
protracted. Also, transactions outside of the ordinary course of business are
subject to the prior approval of the Bankruptcy Court, which may limit the
Debtors&#146; ability to respond timely to certain events or take advantage of
certain opportunities.&#160; Because of the
risks and uncertainties associated with the Debtors&#146; Chapter&nbsp;11
proceedings, the ultimate impact that events that occur during these
proceedings will have on the Debtors&#146; business, financial condition and results
of</font> operations cannot
be accurately predicted or quantified, and there is substantial doubt about the
Debtors&#146; ability to continue as a going concern.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of the filing,
realization of assets and liquidation of liabilities are subject to
uncertainty. While operating as a debtor-in-possession under the protection of
Chapter 11 of the Bankruptcy Code, and subject to Bankruptcy Court approval or
otherwise as permitted in the normal course of business, the Debtors may sell
or otherwise dispose of assets and liquidate or settle liabilities for amounts
other than those reflected in the condensed consolidated financial statements.
Further, a plan of reorganization could materially change the amounts and
classifications reported in the consolidated historical financial statements,
which do not give effect to any adjustments to the carrying value of assets or amounts
of liabilities that might be necessary as a consequence of confirmation of a
plan of reorganization.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Liquidity and Going Concern
Matters</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The accompanying
consolidated financial statements have been prepared assuming the Company will
continue as a going concern.&#160; This
assumes a continuing of operations and the realization of assets and
liabilities in the ordinary course of business.&#160;
The consolidated financial statements do not include any adjustments
that might result if the Company were forced to discontinue operations.&#160; The Company has substantial liquidity needs
in the operation of its business and faces significant liquidity challenges due
to historically high aircraft fuel prices which have reached record levels in June&nbsp;2008.&#160; The Company remains uncertain as to whether
they will obtain debtor in possession financing during the Chapter 11
proceedings.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s business plan
will focus on network adjustments, managing the cost structure and managing
capacity.&#160; The Company&#146;s plans include making
continued capacity and route adjustments</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-11</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession
as of April 10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to the Consolidated
Financial Statements, continued</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">designed to improve
profitability and has terminated its regional partner agreement with Republic
Airlines.&#160; The Company is also addressing
liquidity needs by instituting plans for all or some of the following; the sale
of aircraft, sales and leaseback transactions for aircraft, termination of
lease agreements; and rejection and/or renegotiation of contracts.&#160; The Company&#146;s plan also includes the
implementation of significant cost saving strategies, including workforce
reductions and temporary wage and benefit concessions.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b>Nature of Business and Summary of
Significant Accounting Policies</b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Nature of Business</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company provides air transportation for
passengers and freight through its wholly-owned subsidiaries.&#160; On April&nbsp;3, 2006, Frontier Airlines,&nbsp;Inc.
(&#147;Airlines&#148;) completed its corporate reorganization (the &#147;Reorganization&#148;) and
as a result, Airlines became a wholly-owned subsidiary of Frontier Airlines
Holdings,&nbsp;Inc., a Delaware corporation.&#160;
Airlines was incorporated in the State of Colorado on February&nbsp;8,
1994 and commenced operations on July&nbsp;5, 1994.&#160; In September&nbsp;2006, the Company formed a
new subsidiary, Lynx Aviation,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;Lynx Aviation&#148;).&#160; The Company, in conjunction with its regional
jet partner, currently operates routes linking from its Denver, Colorado hub to
59 destinations including Mexico, Canada and Costa Rica.&#160; As of March&nbsp;31, 2008, the Company
operated a fleet of 49 Airbus A319 aircraft, 11 Airbus A318 aircraft, two
Airbus A320 aircraft, 11 Embraer 170 aircraft (operated by Republic Airlines,&nbsp;Inc.
through June&nbsp;22, 2008) and ten Bombardier Q400 aircraft (operated by Lynx
Aviation) from its base in Denver, and had approximately 6,200 employees.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Lynx Aviation</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Frontier Holdings entered
into a purchase agreement with Bombardier,&nbsp;Inc. for ten Q400 turboprop
aircraft, each with a seating capacity of 74, with the option to purchase ten
additional aircraft.&#160; The purchase
agreement was assumed by Lynx Aviation and Lynx Aviation took title of the
first ten aircraft deliveries which were purchased during the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2008.&#160; During the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2008, Lynx Aviation completed five sale-leaseback transactions on these
aircraft. The aircraft are operated by Lynx Aviation under a separate operating
certificate. Lynx Aviation may exercise its option to purchase the option
aircraft no later than 12 months prior to the first day of the month of the
scheduled delivery date.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Lynx Aviation has entered into a capacity
purchase agreement with Frontier, effective December&nbsp;7, 2007, whereby
Frontier pays Lynx Aviation a contractual amount for the purchased capacity
regardless of the revenue collected on those flights.&#160; The amount paid to Lynx Aviation is based on
operating expenses plus a margin.&#160; The
payments made under this agreement are eliminated in consolidation, and the
passenger revenues generated by Lynx Aviation are included in passenger
revenues in the consolidated statements of operations.&#160; Payments made under the capacity purchase
agreement during the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 were $14,045,000.&#160;&#160; See Note 19 for operating segment
information which includes the presentation of our operating segments and with
how their operations impact the overall network and profitability.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Regional Partners</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s agreement with
Republic Airlines,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;Republic&#148;), which commenced in January&nbsp;2007,
under which Republic operated up to 17 76-seat Embraer 170 aircraft, terminated
in June&nbsp;2008.&#160; The contract was for
an 11-year period from the in-service date of the last aircraft, which was
scheduled for December&nbsp;2008.&#160; The
service began on March&nbsp;4, 2007 and replaced all CRJ 700 aircraft operated
by Horizon Air Industries,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;Horizon&#148;).&#160; The contract with Horizon expired on return
of the last aircraft in November&nbsp;2007.&#160;
Frontier established the scheduling, routes and pricing of the flights
operated under the</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-12</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-12',FILE='C:\JMS\105627\08-16762-3\task3012967\16762-3-ba-15.htm',USER='105627',CD='Jul  1 01:30 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession
as of April 10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to the Consolidated
Financial Statements, continued</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Republic agreement. The
Company compensated Republic for its services based on Republic&#146;s operating
expenses plus a margin on certain of its expenses.&#160; The agreement provided for financial
incentives and penalties based on the performance of Republic which are accrued
for in the period earned.&#160; In April&nbsp;2008,
as part of the bankruptcy proceeding, the Company reached a mutual agreement on
the terms under which Frontier would reject the agreement for a structured
reduction and gradual phase-out of 12 delivered aircraft, which was completed
on June&nbsp;22, 2008.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2007,
Frontier signed a limited-term contract with ExpressJet Airlines,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;ExpressJet&#148;)
to operate two to four 50-seat Embraer 145XR jets on behalf of Frontier.&#160; These jets were used to service previously
announced routes that were intended to be serviced by Lynx Aviation.&#160; Lynx Aviation replaced ExpressJet on these
routes as soon as its certification was completed.&#160; The service by ExpressJet started November&nbsp;15,
2007 and terminated on December&nbsp;6, 2007.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2003, the
Company signed an agreement with Horizon under which Horizon operated up to
nine 70-seat CRJ 700 aircraft.&#160; In September&nbsp;2006,
the Company amended the agreement with Horizon to provide that all nine CRJ-700
aircraft would be returned to Horizon during a one-year ramp down period which
began in January&nbsp;2007. The contract was terminated upon completion of the
ramp down period in November&nbsp;2007.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In accordance with Emerging
Issues Task Force No.&nbsp;01-08, &#147;<i>Determining Whether an
Arrangement Contains a Lease</i>&#148; (&#147;EITF 01-08&#148;), the Company has
concluded that each agreement with the Regional Partners contains a lease as
the agreement conveys the right to use a specific number and specific type of
aircraft over a stated period of time, and as such, has reported revenues and
expenses related to Regional Partners on a gross basis.&#160; Revenues for jointly served routes are
pro-rated to the segment operated by the Regional Partners based on miles flown
and are included in passenger revenues.&#160;
Expenses directly related to the flights flown by the Regional Partners
are included in operating expenses &#151; regional partners.&#160; The Company allocates indirect expenses
between mainline and Regional Partners operations by using Regional Partners
departures, available seat miles, or passengers as a percentage of system
combined departures, available seat miles or passengers.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Preparation of Financial Statements and Use of Estimates</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The preparation of financial statements in
conformity with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles requires
management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts
of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities
at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues
and expenses during the reporting period.&#160;
Actual results could differ from those estimates.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Reclassification of Prior Year Amounts</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain prior year items
have been reclassified to conform to the current year presentation.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Cash and Cash Equivalents</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For financial statement purposes, the Company considers cash and
short-term cash investments with an original maturity of three months or less
to be cash equivalents.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Short-term cash investments consist of the following: (a)&nbsp;bond
money market funds and commercial paper with maturities of less than three
months, classified as held-to-maturity and are carried at amortized cost</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-13</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-13',FILE='C:\JMS\105627\08-16762-3\task3012967\16762-3-ba-15.htm',USER='105627',CD='Jul  1 01:30 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession
as of April 10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to the Consolidated
Financial Statements, continued</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">which approximates fair value and (b)&nbsp;money market funds with
maturities of less than three months, classified as available for sale
securities and stated at fair value.&#160;
Held-to-maturity securities are those securities in which the Company
has the ability and intent to hold the security until maturity.&#160; Interest income is recognized when earned.
There were no unrealized gains or losses on these investments for the years
ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, 2007 and 2006.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Investments Securities</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in .5in .0001pt 9.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Investment securities consist of auction rate
securities with auction reset periods less than 12 months, classified as
available-for-sale securities and stated at fair value.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in .5in .0001pt 9.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Restricted Investments</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in .5in .0001pt 9.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Restricted investments primarily relate to funds held by companies
which process credit card sale transactions and credit card processors are
invested in money market accounts.&#160; They
also include certificates of deposit that secure certain letters of credit
issued for workers compensation claim reserves and certain airport
authorities.&#160; Restricted investments are
carried at cost, which management believes approximates fair value.&#160; Maturities are for one year or less and the
Company intends to hold restricted investments until maturity.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#160; has a contract with
a bankcard processor that requires a holdback of bankcard funds equal to a
certain percentage of our air traffic liability associated with the estimated
amount of bankcard transactions.&#160; As of March&nbsp;31,
2008, that amount totaled $54,500,000.&#160;
In June&nbsp;2008 the Company reached a revised agreement with this
bankcard processor that requires adjustments to the reserve account on a
monthly basis based on current and projected air traffic liability associated
with these estimated bankcard transactions.&#160;
As of June&nbsp;20, 2008, this agreement results in an increase to the
holdback to approximately $61,940,000. The Company and the creditors committee
continue to negotiate the terms of the revised agreement. &#160;In addition, a credit card company began a
holdback during the fiscal year ending March&nbsp;31, 2008 which totaled
$15,500,000 at March&nbsp;31, 2008.&#160; As
of June&nbsp;20, 2008, the requirements resulted in an increase to $22,655,000
for this credit card company.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-14</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER
AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor
and Debtor-in-Possession as of April&nbsp;10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to
the Consolidated Financial Statements, continued</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Valuation and Qualifying
Accounts</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.76%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)&nbsp; Uncollectible accounts written off,
net of recoveries, for the allowance of doubtful accounts</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The allowance for doubtful accounts is
primarily based on the specific identification method.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Inventories</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in .5in .0001pt 9.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Inventories consist of
expendable aircraft spare parts, supplies and aircraft fuel and are stated at
the lower of cost or market.&#160; Inventories
are accounted for on a first-in, first-out basis and are charged to expense as
they are used.&#160; An allowance for
obsolescence on aircraft spare parts is provided over the remaining useful life
of the related aircraft to reduce the carrying costs to lower of cost or
market.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Assets Held For Sale</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Assets held for sale are
valued at the lower of the carrying amount or the estimated market value less
selling costs.&#160; The Company monitors
resale values for its assets held for sale quarterly using an analysis of
current sales and estimates obtained from outside vendors.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Property and Equipment</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Property and equipment are carried at
cost.&#160; Major additions, betterments and
renewals are capitalized.&#160; Depreciation
is provided for on a straight-line basis to estimated residual values over
estimated depreciable lives as follows:</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-15</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-15',FILE='C:\JMS\105627\08-16762-3\task3012967\16762-3-ba-15.htm',USER='105627',CD='Jul  1 01:30 2008' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10,
2008)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements,
continued</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
