<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .55in;text-align:left;text-indent:.7pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Residual values for aircraft
are at 25% of the aircraft cost and 10% for aircraft spare parts.&#160; In estimating useful lives and residual
values of our aircraft, the Company relies upon estimates from industry experts
as well as their anticipated utilization of the aircraft.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 31.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Manufacturers&#146; and Lessor
Credits:&#160; The Company receives credits in
connection with its purchase and lease of aircraft for engines, auxiliary power
units and other rotable parts.&#160; These
credits are deferred until the aircraft, engines, auxiliary power units and
other rotable parts are delivered and then applied as a reduction of the cost
of the related equipment.&#160; The Company
also receives credits in connection with certain aircraft lease agreements.&#160; These credits are recognized as a credit to
lease expense over the lease term.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Deferred Loan Fees</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Deferred loan fees are deferred and amortized
over the term of the related debt obligation.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Fair Value of Financial
Instruments</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company estimates the fair value of its
monetary assets and liabilities based upon existing interest rates related to
such assets and liabilities compared to current rates of interest for
instruments with a similar nature and degree of risk.&#160; The Company estimates that the carrying value
of all of its monetary assets and liabilities approximates fair value as of March&nbsp;31,
2008 and 2007 with the exception of its fixed rate loans and investment
securities.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The estimated fair value of the Company&#146;s
fixed rate loans (which is based on current rates available to the Company for
debt of the same remaining maturity), and the estimated fair value of the
Company&#146;s convertible bonds (which is based on the last available trading price
as of March&nbsp;31, 2008), was approximately $120,154,000 as compared to the
carrying amount of $171,338,000 at March&nbsp;31, 2008. The estimated fair
value of the Company&#146;s fixed rate loans (which is based on current rates
available to the Company for debt of the same remaining maturity), and the
estimated fair value of the Company&#146;s convertible bonds (which is based on the
last available trading price as of March&nbsp;31, 2007) was approximately
$119,923,000 as compared to the carrying amount of $126,314,000 at March&nbsp;31,
2007.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At March&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2008, the fair values
of the auction rate securities (&#147;ARS&#148;), all of which are collateralized by
student loan portfolios and are guaranteed by the United States Government,
were estimated through discounted cash flow models. These models consider,
among other things, the timing of expected future successful auctions, collateralization
of underlying security investments and the credit worthiness of the </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-16</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-16',FILE='C:\JMS\105690\08-16762-3\task3012864\16762-3-ba-17.htm',USER='105690',CD='Jul  1 00:56 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10,
2008)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements,
continued</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">issuer. Beginning in February&nbsp;2008, the
auctions for most of the Company&#146;s holdings in ARS were unsuccessful, resulting
in the Company continuing to hold them beyond their typical auction reset
dates. As a result of the lack of liquidity in the ARS market for the year
ended March&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2008, the Company recorded an unrealized loss on our
ARS of $299,000, which is reflected in accumulated other comprehensive loss in
the consolidated balance sheet.&#160; In
addition to adjusting the carrying value of its ARS, if the assessment of the
valuation adjustment in future periods is other than temporary, the Company
would record an impairment charge through the Statement of Operations.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Revenue Recognition</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Passenger tickets</font></i> - Passenger,
cargo, and other revenues are recognized when the transportation is provided or
after the tickets expire, one year after date of issuance, and are net of
excise taxes, passenger facility charges and security fees.&nbsp; Revenues that
have been deferred are included in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets
as air traffic liability. &#160;Included in
passenger revenue are change fees imposed on passengers for making schedule
changes to non-refundable tickets.&nbsp; Change fees are recognized as revenue
at the time the change fees are collected from the passenger as they are a
separate transaction that occurs subsequent to the date of the original ticket
sale.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Taxes and Fees</font></i> &#150; The Company is
required to charge certain taxes and fees on passenger tickets.&#160; These taxes and fees include U.S. federal
transportation taxes, federal security charges, airport passenger facility
charges and foreign arrival and departure taxes.&#160; These taxes and fees are legal assessments on
the customer, for which the Company has an obligation to act as a collection
agent.&#160; Because the Company is not
entitled to retain these taxes and fees, such amounts are not included in
passenger revenue.&#160; The Company records a
liability when the amounts are collected and reduce the liability when payments
are made to the applicable government agency or operating carrier.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Passenger Traffic
Commissions and Related Expenses</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Passenger traffic commissions and related expenses are
expensed when the transportation is provided and the related revenue is
recognized.&#160; Passenger traffic
commissions and related expenses not yet recognized are included as a prepaid
expense.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Aircraft Maintenance</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company operates under an FAA-approved
continuous inspection and maintenance program. The Company accounts for
maintenance activities on the direct expense method.&#160; Under this method, major overhaul maintenance
costs are recognized as expense as maintenance services are performed, as
flight hours are flown for nonrefundable maintenance payments required by lease
agreements, and as the obligation is incurred for payments made under service
agreements.&#160; Routine maintenance and
repairs are charged to operations as incurred.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective January&nbsp;1, 2003, the Company
entered into an engine maintenance agreement with GE Engine Services,&nbsp;Inc.
(&#147;GE&#148;) covering the scheduled and unscheduled repair of our aircraft engines
used on most of our Airbus aircraft.&#160; The
agreement was subsequently modified and extended in September&nbsp;2004.&#160; The agreement is for a 12-year period from
the effective date for the Company&#146;s owned aircraft or May&nbsp;1, 2019,
whichever comes first. For each leased aircraft, the term coincides with the
initial lease term of 12 years.&#160; This
agreement precludes the Company from using another third party for such
services during the term.&#160; For owned
aircraft, this agreement requires monthly payments at a specified rate
multiplied by the number of flight hours the engines were operated during that
month.&#160; The costs under this agreement
for our </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-17</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-17',FILE='C:\JMS\105690\08-16762-3\task3012864\16762-3-ba-17.htm',USER='105690',CD='Jul  1 00:56 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10,
2008)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements,
continued</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">purchased aircraft for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2008, 2007 and 2006 were approximately $9,890,000, $6,374,000 and $3,545,000,
respectively.&#160; Any unplanned maintenance
expenses not otherwise covered by reserves are paid by the Company.&#160; For leased aircraft that are covered by the
agreement, the Company does not make the flight hour payments to GE under the
agreement; instead the Company makes engine maintenance reserve payments which
are expensed as paid as required under the applicable lease agreements.&#160; At the time a leased engine makes a scheduled
maintenance shop visit, the lessors pay GE directly for the repair of aircraft
engines from reserve accounts established under the applicable lease
documents.&#160; To the extent actual
maintenance expenses incurred exceed these reserves, the Company is required to
pay these amounts.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h6 align="left" style="font-weight:normal;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Advertising Costs</font></i></b></h6>

<h6 align="left" style="font-weight:normal;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></h6>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">The Company expenses the costs of
advertising as promotion and sales expense in the year incurred.&#160; Advertising expense was $10,114,000,
$12,904,000 and $9,588,000 for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, 2007 and
2006, and the amount of expense recognized related to advertising barter
transactions were $2,113,000, $3,814,000, and $2,104,000, respectively.&#160; During the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008,
2007 and 2006, the amount of revenue recognized related to advertising barter
transactions was $1,128,000, $2,463,000, and $1,511,000, respectively.&#160; Prepaid barter expenses as of March&nbsp;31,
2008 and 2007 were $721,000 and $1,038,000, respectively.</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Impairment of Long-Lived Assets</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company records impairment losses on
long-lived assets used in operations when indicators of impairment are present
and the undiscounted future cash flows estimated to be generated by those
assets are less than the carrying amount of the assets.&#160; If an impairment occurs, the loss is measured
by comparing the fair value of the asset to its carrying amount.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Income Taxes</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company accounts for income taxes using the asset and liability
method.&#160; Under that method, deferred
income taxes are recognized for the tax consequences of &#147;temporary differences&#148;
by applying enacted statutory tax rates applicable to future years to
differences between the financial statement carrying amounts and tax bases of
existing assets and liabilities and net operating losses and tax credit
carryforwards.&#160; A valuation allowance is
provided to the extent that it is more likely than not that deferred tax assets
will not be realized.&#160; The effect on
deferred taxes from a change in tax rates is recognized in income in the period
that includes the enactment date.&#160;
Effective April&nbsp;1, 2007, the Company adopted the provisions of
Financial Accounting Standards Board (&#147;FASB&#148;) Interpretation No.&nbsp;48,
Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes, an interpretation of FASB No.&nbsp;109.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Loss Per Common Share</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Basic loss per common share excludes the effect of potentially dilutive
securities and is computed by dividing income by the weighted-average number of
common shares outstanding for the period.&#160;
Diluted earnings per common share reflects the potential dilution of all
securities that could share in earnings. Shares outstanding include shares
contributed to the Employee Stock Ownership Plan.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Customer Loyalty Program</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company offers <i>EarlyReturns</i>, a
frequent flyer program to encourage travel on its airline and customer
loyalty.&#160; The Company accounts for the <i>EarlyReturns</i> program under the incremental cost method
whereby </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-18</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10,
2008)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements,
continued</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">travel awards are valued at the incremental cost of carrying one
passenger based on members that have obtained earned a travel award.&#160; Those incremental costs are based on
expectations of expenses to be incurred on a per passenger basis and include
food and beverages, fuel, liability insurance, and ticketing costs.&#160; The incremental costs do not include
allocations of overhead expenses, salaries, aircraft cost or flight profit or
losses</font>. </font>The Company
records a liability for mileage earned by participants who have reached the
level to become eligible for a free travel award.&#160; The liability includes awards based on the
number of complete free travel awards accumulated in a participant account and
excludes any obligation for partial awards.&#160;
The Company does not record a liability for the expected redemption of
miles for non-travel awards since the cost of these awards to us is negligible.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March&nbsp;31,
2008 and 2007, the Company estimated that approximately 472,000 and 324,000
round-trip flight awards, respectively, were eligible for redemption by
EarlyReturns members who have mileage credits exceeding the 15,000-mile free
round-trip domestic ticket award threshold.&#160;
As of March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007, the Company had recorded a liability
of approximately $10,059,000 and $4,249,000, respectively, for these
rewards.&#160; The increase in the liability
is primarily related to the increase in the incremental cost of carriage which
is significantly impacted by fuel price fluctuations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company also
sells points in <i>EarlyReturns</i> to
third parties.&#160; The portion of the sale
that is for travel is deferred and recognized as passenger revenue when the
Company estimates the transportation is provided.&#160; The remaining portion, referred to as the
marketing component, is recognized as other revenue in the month received.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Co-Branded Credit Card
Arrangement</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">The Company
entered into a co-branded credit card arrangement with a MasterCard issuing
bank in March&nbsp;2003.&#160; This affinity
agreement provides that the Company will receive a fixed fee for each new
account, which varies based on the type of account, and a percentage of the
annual renewal fees that the bank receives.&#160;
The Company receives an increased fee for new accounts it solicits.&#160; The Company also receives fees for the
purchase of frequent flier miles awarded to the credit card customers.</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company accounts for all fees received under the co-branded credit
card program by allocating the fees between the portion that represents the
estimated value of the subsequent travel award to be provided, and the portion
which represents a marketing fee to cover marketing and other related costs to
administer the program.&#160; This latter
portion (referred to as the marketing component) represents the residual after
determination of the value of the travel component.&#160; The component representing travel is
determined by reference to an equivalent restricted fare, which is used as a
proxy for the value of travel of a frequent flyer mileage award. The travel
component is deferred and recognized as revenue over the estimated usage period
of the frequent flyer mileage awards of 20 months.&#160; The Company has estimated the period over
which the frequent flier mileage awards will be used based on the usage period
history of the frequent flier mileage awards. The Company records the marketing
component of the revenue earned under this agreement as other revenue in the
month received.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, the Company received total fees
of $44,369,000.&#160; Of that amount,
$25,545,000 was initially deferred as the travel component, and the remaining
marketing component of $18,824,000 was recognized as other revenue.&#160; For the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007, the
Company received total fees of $36,917,000 under the credit card
agreement.&#160; Of that amount, $25,219,000
was deferred as the travel component, and the remaining marketing component of
$11,698,000 was recognized as other revenue.&#160;
For the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2006, the Company received total fees
of $24,986,000.&#160; Of that amount,
$19,686,000 was deferred as the travel component, and the remaining marketing
component of </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-19</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10,
2008)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements,
continued</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$5,300,000 was recognized as other revenue.&#160; Amortization of deferred revenue recognized
in earnings during the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, 2007 and 2006 was
$24,789,000, $20,158,000 and $11,059,000, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h6 align="left" style="font-weight:normal;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Supplemental Disclosure of Cash Flow Information</font></i></b></h6>

<h6 align="left" style="font-weight:normal;line-height:normal;margin:0in .5in .0001pt 9.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></h6>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Cash Paid During the Year for</font></i></b><i>:</i></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2008</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.66%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.2%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2007</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.66%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.2%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2006</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.44%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="38%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:38.92%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.66%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="55%" colspan="8" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:55.96%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(In&nbsp;thousands)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.44%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="38%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:38.92%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.66%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.64%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.58%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">34,197</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.66%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.64%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.54%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28,047</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.66%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.64%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.54%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18,911</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.44%;">

  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="38%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:38.92%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Taxes</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.66%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.64%;">

  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.58%;">

  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.66%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.44%;">

</table>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest incurred during the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2008 was $39,062,000, of which $2,618,000 was capitalized.&#160; Interest incurred during the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2007 was $31,948,000, of which $2,050,000 was capitalized.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Non-Cash Items</font></i></b><i>:</i></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Application
of Pre-Delivery Payments</font></b> - In the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, 2007 and 2006, the Company
applied pre-delivery payments of $67,023,000, $34,946,000 and $19,513,000,
respectively, towards the purchase price of aircraft and LiveTV equipment.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">LiveTV
Hardware Agreement</font></b> -
During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, the Company sold LiveTV equipment of
$14,668,000 in exchange for a note receivable (see Note 5).&#160; The Company also had a non-cash charge of
$1,900,000 for the difference between the net present value of the of the
purchase price and the net book value of the equipment sold.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Impairment
of Available for Sale Securities</font></b> - During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, the Company wrote-down the
fair value of available-for-sale securities by $299,000, which is reflected in
other comprehensive loss.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Derivative Instruments</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company accounts for derivative financial instruments in accordance with the
provisions of Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No.&nbsp;133, <i>&#147;Accounting for Derivative Instruments and Hedging
Activities&#148;</i> (&#147;SFAS 133&#148;),</font> as amended and
interpreted.&#160; SFAS 133 requires the
Company to measure all derivatives at fair value and to recognize them in the
balance sheet as an asset or liability.&#160;
For derivatives designated as cash flow hedges, changes in fair value of
the derivative are generally reported in other comprehensive income (&#147;OCI&#148;) and
are subsequently reclassified into earnings when the hedged item affects
earnings.&#160; Changes in fair value of
derivative instruments not designated as hedging instruments and ineffective
portions of hedges are recognized in earnings in the current period.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Accounting for Long-Lived
Assets.</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
accounting for long-lived assets, the Company makes estimates about the
expected useful lives, projected residual values and the potential for
impairment.&#160; In estimating useful lives
and residual values of the aircraft, the Company has relied upon actual
industry experience with the same or similar aircraft types and the anticipated
utilization of the aircraft.&#160; The Company&#146;s
long-lived assets are evaluated for impairment at least annually or when events
and circumstances indicate that the assets may be impaired. Indicators include
operating or cash flow losses, significant decreases in market value or changes
in technology.&#160; The Company&#146;s assets are
all relatively new and aircraft are actively deployed in the </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-20</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-20',FILE='C:\JMS\105690\08-16762-3\task3012864\16762-3-ba-17.htm',USER='105690',CD='Jul  1 00:56 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10,
2008)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements,
continued</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Company&#146;s
route system.&#160; The Company has recently
sold aircraft in amounts that are in excess of their carrying values.&#160; The Company has not identified any
significant impairments related to long-lived assets at this time.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Self-Insurance</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company is self-insured for the majority of the group health insurance costs,
subject to specific retention levels.&#160;
The Company records its liability for health insurance claims based on
its estimate of claims that have been incurred but not reported.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company is also self-insured for the majority of its workers&#146; compensation
cost.&#160; The liability for workers&#146;
compensation claims is the estimated total cost of the claims on a
fully-developed basis, up to a maximum stop loss coverage.&#160; The Company engaged a specialist to assist in
evaluating estimates of reserves for claims.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Stock-Based Compensation</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective April&nbsp;1, 2006, the Company
adopted the provisions of Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No.&nbsp;123(R),<i> Share-Based Payment</i>, and related
interpretations (&#147;SFAS 123(R)&#148;), to account for stock-based compensation using
the modified prospective transition method and therefore did not restate prior
period results.&#160; SFAS 123(R)&nbsp;supersedes
Accounting Principles Board Opinion No.&nbsp;25<i>,
Accounting for Stock Issued to Employees</i> (&#147;APB No.&nbsp;25&#148;), and
revises guidance in SFAS 123,<i> Accounting for
Stock-Based Compensation</i>. Among other things, SFAS 123(R)&nbsp;requires
that compensation expense be recognized in the financial statements for
share-based awards based on the grant date fair value of those awards. The
modified prospective transition method applies to both (1)&nbsp;unvested awards
under the Company&#146;s 2004 Equity Incentive Plan (&#147;2004 Plan&#148;) outstanding as of March&nbsp;31,
2006, based on the grant date fair value estimated in accordance with the pro
forma provisions of SFAS 123 and (2)&nbsp;any new share-based awards granted
subsequent to March&nbsp;31, 2006, based on the grant-date fair value estimated
in accordance with the provisions of SFAS 123(R). Additionally, stock-based
compensation expense includes an estimate for pre-vesting forfeitures and is
recognized over the requisite service periods of the awards on a straight-line
basis, which is commensurate with the vesting term. The Company&#146;s options are
typically granted with graded vesting provisions, and compensation cost is
amortized over the service period using the straight-line method.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">New Accounting Standards
Not Yet Adopted</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2006, the
Financial Accounting Standards Board (&#147;FASB&#148;) issued Statement of Financial
Accounting Standards (&#147;SFAS&#148;) No.&nbsp;157, <i>Fair Value Measurements</i>
(&#147;FAS 157&#148;). FAS 157 defines fair value, establishes a framework for measuring
fair value under U.S. generally accepted accounting principles and expands
disclosures about fair value measurements. FAS 157 is effective for financial
statements issued for fiscal years beginning after November&nbsp;15, 2007 and
interim periods within those fiscal years. The Company has considered the
impact of adopting FAS 157 and does not believe it will result in a material
cumulative effect adjustment on the consolidated financial statements when
adopted on April&nbsp;1, 2008.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February&nbsp;2007, the
FASB issued Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No.&nbsp;159, <i>The Fair Value Option for Financial Assets and Financial Liabilities</i>
(&#147;FAS 159&#148;). This standard permits companies to choose to measure many
financial instruments and certain other items at fair value, following the </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-21</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-21',FILE='C:\JMS\105690\08-16762-3\task3012864\16762-3-ba-17.htm',USER='105690',CD='Jul  1 00:56 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10,
2008)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements,
continued</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">provisions of FAS 157. FAS
159 is effective for fiscal years beginning after November&nbsp;15, 2007. The
Company has not yet determined the impact of adopting FAS 159.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In March&nbsp;2008, the FASB issued Statement
of Financial Accounting Standards No.&nbsp;161, <i>Disclosures
about Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activities - an Amendment of FASB
Statement 133 </i>(&#147;FAS 161&#148;). This standard enhances required
disclosures regarding derivatives and hedging activities to help investors
better understand how derivative instruments and hedging activities affect an
entity&#146;s financial position, financial performance and cash flows.&#160; Requirements under FAS 161 include disclosure
of the objectives for using derivative instruments, disclosure of the fair
values of derivative instruments and their gains and losses in a tabular
format, disclosure of credit risk related features, and cross-referencing
within the footnotes of derivative-related information.&#160; FAS 161 is effective for fiscal years and interim
periods beginning after November&nbsp;15, 2008. The Company expects to comply
with the disclosure provision of adopting FAS 161 upon adoption.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">3.</font></i></b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-style:normal;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="font-style:normal;">Derivative
Instruments</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fuel Hedging</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s operations are inherently dependent upon the price of and
availability of aircraft fuel.&#160; In November&nbsp;2002,
the Company initiated a fuel hedging program using a variety of financial
derivative instruments.&nbsp; These fuel hedges do not qualify for hedge
accounting under SFAS 133, and, as such, realized and non-cash marks to market
adjustments are included in aircraft fuel expense.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The results of operations for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, 2007
and 2006 include non-cash mark to market derivative gains/(losses) of
$1,847,000, $12,753,000 and $(2,163,000), respectively. Cash settlements for
fuel derivatives contracts settled during the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008,
2007 and 2006 were receipts of $30,740,000, payments of $3,925,000 and receipts
of $5,338,000, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Due to the Company&#146;s Chapter 11 filings, all
fuel hedge contracts outstanding as of March&nbsp;31, 2008 were terminated in May&nbsp;2008
and subsequently settled for cash proceeds of $23,409,000.&#160; Our statement of operations in 2008 included
a reduction of fuel expense of $30,740,000 as a result of our cash settlements
and $1,847,000 in non-cash mark to market derivative gains from our fuel
hedging contracts, that are not expected to reoccur in the Company&#146;s fiscal
year ended March&nbsp;31, 2009.&#160;
Additionally, the price for fuel has risen from the average price during
the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 of $2.45 per gallon to $4.22 as of June&nbsp;23,
2008.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table summarizes the components of aircraft fuel expense
for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, 2007 and 2006:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company entered into the following swap and collar agreements outstanding at March&nbsp;31,
2008 and 2007, which had fair values resulting in assets of $15,576,000 and
$13,729,000, respectively:</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession
as of April 10, 2008)</font></b></p>

  </td>
  <td width="20%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:20.12%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">80,000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.28%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:16.82%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">January&nbsp;1, 2008 - March&nbsp;31, 2008</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.28%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:25.98%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$62.60 per barrel cap, with a floor of $52.10</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.58%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 22.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-22.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="95%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:26.35pt;width:95.16%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:4.04%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="95%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:95.96%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Jet A is Gulf Coast Jet
  A fuel. Crude oil is West Texas Intermediate crude oil. Jet A Crack spread
  swaps are hedges in which the Company has hedged the difference between Gulf
  Cost Jet A fuel costs and the West Texas Intermediate crude oil costs.</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:4.04%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">**</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="95%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:95.96%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">One barrel is equal to 42 gallons.</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 17.5pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-17.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">4.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b>Assets Held For Sale</b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In April&nbsp;2005, the Company retired its
remaining Boeing aircraft and has classified all remaining Boeing aircraft
rotable spare parts and expendable inventories as &#147;assets held for sale.&#148;&#160; As such, these assets have been valued at the
lower of the carrying amount or the estimated market value less selling costs.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In August&nbsp;2004, the
Company began selling Boeing spare parts and entered into agreements with two
vendors to sell these parts on a consignment basis.&#160; The Company monitors resale values for Boeing
parts quarterly using estimates obtained from outside vendors.&#160; During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2005,
the Company recorded total impairments on Boeing rotable spare parts and
expendable inventories of $5,123,000 due to declines in the resale values of
these parts.&#160; Based on the current market
prices and recent sales history, the Company has determined that there is
currently no additional impairment required for the Boeing rotable spare parts
and expendable inventories for the years ending March&nbsp;31, 2008 and
2007.&#160; During the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2008 and 2007, the Company realized net gains of $429,000 and $1,203,000,
respectively, on the sale of these assets.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-24</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-24',FILE='C:\JMS\105690\08-16762-3\task3012864\16762-3-ba-17.htm',USER='105690',CD='Jul  1 00:56 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession
as of April 10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to the Consolidated
Financial Statements, continued</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">5.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b>Live TV</b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January&nbsp;2008, the
Company entered into two separate agreements with LiveTV LLC (&#147;LiveTV&#148;): an
In-Flight Entertainment System Hardware Agreement (&#147;Hardware Agreement&#148;); and
an In-Flight Entertainment System Services Agreement (&#147;Service Agreement&#148;)
which replaced the existing LiveTV agreement in place.&#160; Under the Hardware Agreement, the Company
sold all of its purchased in-seat video entertainment systems to LiveTV in
exchange for a note receivable payable to the Company over the lesser of the
remaining useful life of the aircraft in which the equipment was installed or
12 years.&#160; The Company recognized a loss
on the sale of the equipment of $1,900,000 for the difference between the net
present value of the purchase price of the equipment sold and its net book
value.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Services Agreement
provides the Company&#146;s customers with in-seat video entertainment and LiveTV
retains all access fee revenues under the agreement, subject to certain
quarterly minimum revenue guarantees if certain usage percentage thresholds are
not met.&#160; As such, as of January&nbsp;2008,
the Company no longer records revenue for LiveTV and pay-per movies or pays
monthly service fees, and only records expenses for services in which the
Company provided the service free to the customer. To the extent usage thresholds
are not met, the quarterly minimum revenue guarantee is payable for the
difference between achieved revenue and the quarterly minimum.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">6.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b>Property and Equipment, Net</b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007, property and equipment consisted of
the following:</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:right;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,019,166</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.64%;">
