<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-33',FILE='C:\JMS\pmurali\08-16762-3\task3013036\16762-3-ba-19.htm',USER='105425',CD='Jul  1 01:52 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10,
2008)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements,
continued</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008
and 2007, the Company recorded a valuation allowance against net deferred tax
assets.&nbsp; In assessing the realizability of deferred tax assets, management
considers whether it is more likely than not that some portion, or all, of the
deferred tax assets will not be realized.&nbsp; The ultimate realization of
deferred tax assets is dependent upon the generation of future taxable income
during the periods in which those temporary differences become deductible.&nbsp;
Management considers the scheduled reversal of deferred tax liabilities,
projected future taxable income, and tax planning strategies in making this
assessment.&nbsp; The Company acquired a significant number of new aircraft
over the past seven years in conjunction with their fleet transition
plan.&nbsp; New aircraft purchases are depreciated for tax purposes over seven
years compared to book depreciation of 25 years, resulting in significant
deferred tax liabilities that will reverse over their seven year tax
life.&nbsp; The net operating losses that have been generated over the past
seven years are due in large part to the accelerated depreciation over a
shorter useful lifes for tax purposes.&nbsp; The Company expects their fleet
acquisitions to be substantially complete by fiscal 2009.&nbsp; Since the
Company&#146;s net operating losses do not begin to expire until 2023, the Company
expects these net operating losses to be available in future periods when tax
depreciation is at minimal levels, and taxable income is projected to exceed
book income. Based upon the level of historical book losses, the Company
established a valuation allowance during the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 for
the net deferred tax asset.&nbsp;&nbsp; Based upon the projections for future
taxable income over the periods in which the deferred tax assets become
deductible, and available tax planning strategies, management believes it is
more likely than not that the Company will realize the benefits of the
deductible differences, net of the existing valuation allowances at March&nbsp;31,
2008 and 2007.&nbsp;&#160; The amount of the
deferred tax asset considered realizable, however, could be reduced in the near
term if estimates of future taxable income during the carryforward period are
reduced.&nbsp; The Company has included in the total valuation allowance, a
valuation allowance for state net operating loss carryforwards expected to
expire unused which totaled $1,343,000 and $583,000 at March&nbsp;31, 2008 and
2007, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March&nbsp;31, 2008, the Company had
federal net operating loss carryforwards totaling $421,100,000, expiring as
follows:&nbsp; $45,600,000 in 2023, $58,900,000 in 2024, $92,300,000 in 2025,
$51,800,000 in 2026 and $69,500,000 in 2027 and $103,000,000 estimated for 2008
which would expire in 2028.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In July&nbsp;2006, the Financial Accounting
Standards Board (FASB) issued FASB Interpretation No.&nbsp;48, &#147;<i>Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes &#150; an Interpretation of FASB
Statement No.&nbsp;109</i>&#148; (FIN 48). The purpose of FIN 48 is to
clarify certain aspects of the recognition and measurement related to
accounting for income tax uncertainties.&#160;
Under FIN 48 the impact of an uncertain tax position must be recognized
in the financial statements if that position is more likely than not of being
sustained upon audit by the relevant taxing authority.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company adopted the provisions of FIN 48
as of April&nbsp;1, 2007.&#160; At that time
the Company did not have any material uncertain tax positions, as a result,
there were no adjustments to the opening balance sheet retained earnings.&#160; The Company believes that its tax filing
positions and deductions related to tax periods subject to examination will be
sustained upon audit and does not anticipate any adjustments will</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-34</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-34',FILE='C:\JMS\pmurali\08-16762-3\task3013036\16762-3-ba-19.htm',USER='105425',CD='Jul  1 01:52 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10,
2008)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements,
continued</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">result in a material adverse effect on the
Company&#146;s financial condition, results of operations, or cash flow.&#160; Therefore, no reserves for uncertain income
tax positions have been recorded pursuant to FIN 48.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s policy is to recognize interest
and penalties related to unrecognized tax benefits in interest expense and
other non-operating income (expense), respectively, in our consolidated
statement of operations.&#160; For the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 there was no interest expense or penalties related to
uncertain tax positions.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has unused U.S. federal and state
NOLs for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2003 through March&nbsp;31, 2008.&#160; As such, these years remain subject to
examination by the relevant taxing authorities.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Bankruptcy Court entered a final order
that restricts the trading on the common stock and debt interests in the
Company.&#160; The NOLs can be used to offset
future taxable income, and thus are a valuable asset of the Company&#146;s
estate.&#160; Certain trading in the Company&#146;s
stock (or debt when the Company is in bankruptcy) could adversely affect the
Company&#146;s ability to use the NOLs.&#160; Thus,
the Company obtained an order that enables it to closely monitor certain
transfers of stock and claims, and restricts those transfers that may
compromise the Company&#146;s ability to use its NOLs.&#160; However, if a change in ownership does occur,
as defined in IRC Section&nbsp;382, this could result in the need for an
addition valuation allowance, which the Company expects would be material. As
of March&nbsp;31, 2008, the Company does not believe an ownership change has
occurred.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 22.5pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">13.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b>Stockholders&#146; Equity</b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Warrants and
Stock Purchase Rights</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February&nbsp;2003, the Company issued
warrants to purchase 3,833,946 shares of common stock at $6.00 per share to the
Air Transportation Stabilization Board (&#147;ATSB&#148;) and to two other guarantors
which were exercisable immediately.&#160; The
warrants had an estimated fair value of $9,283,000 when issued and expire seven
years after issuance. The fair value for these options was estimated at the
date of grant using a Black-Scholes option pricing model. These warrants were
subsequently repriced in September&nbsp;2003 as a result of the Company&#146;s
secondary public offering and again in December&nbsp;2005 as a result of the
Company&#146;s convertible debt offering to $5.87 per share.&#160; In May&nbsp;2006, the ATSB transferred the
ownership of all its outstanding warrants to seven institutional investors. One
other guarantor transferred ownership of its outstanding warrants in December&nbsp;2003.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Treasury Stock
and Unearned ESOP Shares</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In March&nbsp;2007, the Company purchased
300,000 shares of its common stock for $1,838,000.&#160; These shares were purchased to fund the Company&#146;s
2007 contribution to the Employee Stock Ownership Plan (&#147;ESOP&#148;). These shares
were subsequently contributed to the ESOP.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">14.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b>Equity Based Compensation Plans</b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On September&nbsp;9, 2004, the shareholders
of Frontier approved the 2004 Plan.&#160;
Frontier Holdings assumed all of the outstanding options and awards
under the 2004 Plan effective upon the closing of the Reorganization.&#160; The 2004 Plan, which includes stock options
issued since 1994 under a previous equity incentive plan, allows the
Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors to grant stock options, stock
appreciation rights payable only in stock (&#147;SARs&#148;), and restricted stock units
(&#147;RSUs&#148;), any or all of which may be made contingent upon the achievement of
service or performance criteria.&#160; Eligible
participants</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-35</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-35',FILE='C:\JMS\pmurali\08-16762-3\task3013036\16762-3-ba-19.htm',USER='105425',CD='Jul  1 01:52 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10,
2008)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements,
continued</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">include members of the Company&#146;s Board of
Directors, all full-time director and officer level employees of the Company,
and such other employees as may be identified by the Compensation Committee
from time to time who are legally eligible to participate.&#160; Subject to plan limits, the Compensation
Committee has the discretionary authority to determine the size and timing of
an award and the vesting requirements related to the award.&#160; The 2004 Plan expires September&nbsp;12,
2009.&#160; The 2004 Plan allows up to a
maximum of 2,500,000 shares for option grants and 500,000 shares for RSUs,
subject to adjustment only to reflect stock splits and similar recapitalization
events.&#160; The Company issues new shares of
common stock for stock option and SARs exercised and settlement of vested
restricted units.&#160; With certain
exceptions, stock options and SARs issued under the 2004 Plan generally vest in
equal installments over a five-year period from the date of grant and expire
ten years from the grant date.&#160; RSUs
cliff vest on the third or fifth anniversary of the date of grant.&#160; As of March&nbsp;31, 2008, the Company had
1,560,000 shares available for future grants.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SFAS 123(R)&nbsp;requires the Company to
estimate pre-vesting option forfeitures at the time of grant and periodically
revise those estimates in subsequent periods if actual forfeitures differ from
those estimates. The Company records stock-based compensation expense only for
those awards expected to vest using an estimated forfeiture rate based on its
historical pre-vesting forfeiture data.&#160;
Previously, the Company accounted for forfeitures as they occurred under
the pro forma disclosure provisions of SFAS 123 for periods prior to April&nbsp;1,
2006.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and March&nbsp;31,
2007, the Company recorded $1,069,000 and $845,000, respectively,&#160; for stock options, stock appreciation rights
and restricted stock units, net of estimated forfeitures. Unrecognized
stock-based compensation expense related to unvested options and RSU awards
outstanding as of March&nbsp;31, 2008 was approximately $4,847,000, and will be
recorded over the remaining vesting periods of one to five years. At March&nbsp;31,
2008, the remaining weighted average recognition period for options and RSUs
was 3.5 years and 3.2 years, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SFAS 123(R)&nbsp;requires the benefits
associated with tax deductions in excess of recognized compensation cost to be
reported as a financing cash flow rather than as an operating cash flow as
previously required. For the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and March&nbsp;31,
2007, the Company did not record any excess tax benefit generated from option
exercises.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Prior to April&nbsp;1, 2006, the Company
accounted for stock-based compensation in accordance with APB No.&nbsp;25 and
related interpretations.&#160; Accordingly,
compensation expense for a stock option grant was recognized only if the
exercise price was less than the market value of the Company&#146;s common stock on
the grant date. The accounting for stock-based compensation for restricted
stock units did not change with the adoption of SFAS 123(R).&#160; Prior to the Company&#146;s adoption of SFAS
123(R), as required under the disclosure provisions of SFAS 123, as amended,
the Company provided pro forma net loss and loss per common share for each
period as if the Company had applied the fair value method to stock option
grants, amortized on a straight-line basis, to measure stock-based compensation
expense.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-36</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-36',FILE='C:\JMS\pmurali\08-16762-3\task3013036\16762-3-ba-19.htm',USER='105425',CD='Jul  1 01:52 2008' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER
AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor
and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  </td>

</table>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 18.7pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The table below summarizes the impact on the
Company&#146;s results of operations for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and March&nbsp;31,
2007 of outstanding SARs and RSUs issued under the 2004 Plan as recognized
under the provisions of SFAS 123(R):</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 18.7pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Stock Options
and SARs</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company utilizes a Black-Scholes-Merton
option pricing model to estimate the fair value of share-based awards under
SFAS 123(R), which is the same valuation technique the Company previously used
for pro forma disclosures under SFAS 123.&nbsp; The Black-Scholes-Merton option
pricing model incorporates various and subjective assumptions, including
expected term and expected volatility.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-37</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-37',FILE='C:\JMS\105579\08-16762-3\task3011486\16762-3-ba-21.htm',USER='105579',CD='Jun 29 06:00 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER
AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor
and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to
the Consolidated Financial Statements, continued</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company estimates the expected term of
options and SARs granted using its historical exercise patterns, which the
Company believes are representative of future exercise behavior.&#160; The Company estimates volatility of its
common stock using the historical closing prices of its common stock for the period
equal to the expected term of the options, which the Company believes is
representative of the future behavior of the common stock.&#160; The Company&#146;s risk-free interest rate
assumption is determined using the Federal Reserve nominal rates for U.S.
Treasury zero-coupon bonds with maturities similar to those of the expected
term of the award being valued.&#160; The
Company has never paid any cash dividends on its common stock and the Company
does not anticipate paying any cash dividends in the foreseeable future.
Therefore, the Company assumed an expected dividend yield of zero.&#160; Stock options and SARs are classified as
equity awards.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table shows the Company&#146;s
assumptions used to compute the stock-based compensation expense and pro forma
information for stock option and SAR grants issued during the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2008, 2007 and 2006:</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The per share weighted-average grant-date
fair value of SARs granted during fiscal year 2008 was $3.10 using the above
weighted-average assumptions.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A summary of the stock option and SARs
activity and related information for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 is as
follows:</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="15%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.62%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Average</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.32%;">

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Exercise prices for options and SARs
outstanding under the 2004 Plan as of March&nbsp;31, 2008 ranged from $2.13 per
share to $24.17 per share.&#160; The
weighted-average remaining contractual life of these equity awards is 3.8
years.&#160; The aggregate intrinsic value of
vested options and SARs was $9,000 as of March&nbsp;31, 2008 and the intrinsic
value of options exercised during the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 was $57,000.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-38</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER
AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor
and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to
the Consolidated Financial Statements, continued</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A summary of the outstanding and exercisable
options and SARs at March&nbsp;31, 2008, segregated by exercise price ranges,
is as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="93%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:9.35pt;width:93.22%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="21%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:21.12%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.68%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.88%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.68%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

</table>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Restricted
Stock Units</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SFAS 123R requires that the grant-date fair
value of RSUs be equal to the market price of the share on the date of grant if
vesting is based on a service condition.&#160;
The grant-date fair value of RSU awards are being expensed over the
vesting period.&#160; RSUs are classified as
equity awards. As of March&nbsp;31, 2008, the Company had outstanding RSUs with
service conditions and vesting periods that range from three to five years.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">A summary of the activity for RSUs for the
twelve months ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 is as follows</font>:</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-39',FILE='C:\JMS\105579\08-16762-3\task3011486\16762-3-ba-21.htm',USER='105579',CD='Jun 29 06:00 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER
AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor
and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to
the Consolidated Financial Statements, continued</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">15.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Retirement Plans</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 align="left" style="font-weight:bold;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">ESOP</font></i></b></h2>

<h2 align="left" style="font-weight:bold;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has established an ESOP which is
for the benefit of each employee of the Company, except those employees covered
by a collective bargaining agreement that does not provide for participation in
the ESOP.&#160; Company contributions to the
ESOP are discretionary and may vary from year to year.&#160; In order for an employee to receive an
allocation of Company common stock from the ESOP, the employee must be employed
on the last day of the ESOP&#146;s plan year, with certain exceptions.&#160; The Company&#146;s annual contribution to the
ESOP, if any, is allocated among the eligible employees of the Company as of
the end of each plan year in proportion to the relative compensation (as
defined in the ESOP) earned that plan year by each of the eligible
employees.&#160; The ESOP does not provide for
contributions by participating employees.&#160;
Employees vest in contributions made to the ESOP based upon their years
of service with the Company.&#160; A year of
service is an ESOP plan year during which an employee has at least 1,000 hours
of service.&#160; Vesting generally occurs at
the rate of 20% per year, beginning after the first year of service, so that a
participating employee will be fully vested after five years of service.&#160; Distributions from the ESOP will not be made
to employees during employment.&#160; However,
upon termination of employment with the Company, each employee will be entitled
to receive the vested portion of his or her account balance.&#160; Forfeitures are reallocated among active
participants.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In March&nbsp;2008, the Company issued and
contributed 300,000 shares to the ESOP. In March&nbsp;2007, the Company&#146;s Board
of Directors approved the purchase of 300,000 shares of its common stock.&#160; These shares were used to fund the 2007 ESOP
contribution, and the shares were contributed in April&nbsp;2007. During the
year ended March&nbsp;31, 2006, the Company issued and contributed 400,000
shares to the ESOP.&#160; Total Company
contributions to the ESOP from inception total 3,187,000 shares, including the
300,000 shares contributed in March&nbsp;2008.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company recognized compensation expense
during the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, 2007 and 2006 of $1,584,000,
$2,564,000, and $2,969,000, respectively, related to its contributions to the
ESOP.&#160; Compensation expense under the
ESOP is determined by multiplying the number of shares contributed by the fair
market value of the shares on the date contributed, or the purchase price of
the shares.&#160; The fair value of the
unearned ESOP shares contributed to the ESOP for the year ended March&nbsp;31,
2008 was $822,000.&#160; The fair value of the
unearned ESOP shares on March&nbsp;31, 2008 was $759,000.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="left" style="font-weight:normal;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Retirement Savings Plans</font></i></b></h3>

<h3 align="left" style="font-weight:normal;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></h3>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has established a Retirement
Savings Plan under section 401(k)&nbsp;of the Internal Revenue Code (&#147;401(k)&nbsp;Plan&#148;).&#160; Participants may contribute from 1% to 60% of
their pre-tax annual compensation up to the maximum amount allowed under the
Internal Revenue Code.&#160; Participants are
immediately vested in their voluntary contributions.&#160; The Company&#146;s Board of Directors has elected
to match 50% of participant contributions up to 10% of salaries from May&nbsp;2000
through December&nbsp;2007 for the participants of the 401(k)&nbsp;Plan.&#160; During the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008,
2007, and 2006, the Company recognized compensation expense associated with the
matching contributions to the 401(k)&nbsp;Plan totaling $6,036,000, $5,107,000,
and $4,201,000, respectively.&#160; Future
matching contributions, if any, will be determined annually by the Board of
Directors.&#160; In order to receive the
matching contribution, participants must be employed on the last day of the
plan year.&#160; Participants vest in employer
contributions made to the 401(k)&nbsp;Plan based upon their years of service
with the Company.&#160; A year of service is a
plan year during which a participant has at least 1,000 hours of service.&#160; Vesting generally occurs at the rate of 20%
per year,</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-40</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-40',FILE='C:\JMS\105579\08-16762-3\task3011486\16762-3-ba-21.htm',USER='105579',CD='Jun 29 06:00 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER
AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor
and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to
the Consolidated Financial Statements, continued</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">beginning after the first year of service, so
that a participant will be fully vested after five years of service.&#160; Upon termination of employment with the
Company, each participant will be entitled to receive the vested portion of his
or her account balance.&#160; The Company
suspended the match effective June&nbsp;1, 2008.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On March&nbsp;2, 2007, the Company
established the Frontier Airlines,&nbsp;Inc. Pilots Retirement Plan (&#147;the FAPA
Plan&#148;) for pilots covered under the collective bargaining agreement with the
Frontier Airlines Pilots&#146; Association. The FAPA Plan is a defined contribution
retirement plan.&#160; The Company contributes
up to 6% of each eligible and active participant&#146;s compensation.&#160; Contributions begin after a pilot has reached
two years of service and the contributions vest immediately.&#160; Participants are entitled to begin receiving
distributions of all vested amounts beginning at age 59 &#189;. During the years
ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007, the Company recognized compensation expense
associated with the contributions to the FAPA Plan of $2,951,000 and $238,000,
respectively.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Retirement Health Plans</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">In conjunction
with the Company&#146;s collective bargaining agreement with its pilots, retired
pilots and their dependents, were entitled retain medical benefits under the
terms and conditions of the Health and Welfare Plan for Employees of Frontier
Airlines,&nbsp;Inc. (the &#147;Retirement Health Plan&#148;) until age 65.&#160; On December&nbsp;14, 2007, the Fair Treatment
for Experienced Pilots Act (the &#147;Pilots Act&#148;) was enacted.&#160; This act, increased the retirement age for
commercial pilots to 65 from 60.&#160; Pilots
that have not reached age 60 will now be allowed to work for five more years,
provided they pass regular medical and piloting exams.</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">Pursuant to the
Company&#146;s collective bargaining agreement with its pilots, if pilots are forced
to retire due to FAA requirements, the retired pilots and their dependents
could retain medical benefits under the terms and conditions of the Retirement
Health Plan until age 65.&#160; However, as a
result of the Pilots Act, this retirement health benefit is no longer required.
It is only required for pilots who reached mandatory retirement age prior to
the effective date of the Pilots Act.</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">The Company
recorded a one-time post-retirement liability curtailment gain of $6,361,000 to
reflect the impact of the Pilots Act, which was a reduction in post-retirement
liability for pilots who had not yet attained the age of 60.&#160; A liability of $319,000 remains for the
pilots who had previously reached the mandatory retirement age prior to the
Pilots Act.</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">On March&nbsp;31,
2007, the Company adopted the recognition and disclosure provisions of SFAS
158.&#160; SFAS 158 required the Company to
recognize the funded status (i.e., the difference between the fair value of
plan assets and the projected benefit obligations) of its benefit plans in the March&nbsp;31,
2007 consolidated balance sheet, with a corresponding adjustment to accumulated
other comprehensive income, net of tax.&#160;&#160;
The net adjustment to other comprehensive income at adoption was
$36,000, ($22,000 net of tax) and represents the net unrecognized actuarial
losses and unrecognized prior service costs.</font></i></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-41</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to
the Consolidated Financial Statements, continued</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">The following
table provides a reconciliation of the changes in the benefit obligations under
the Retirement Health Plan for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007:</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">Reconciliation
of benefit obligation:</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.38%;">

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.26%;">

  </td>

 <tr>
  <td width="62%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:62.48%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Service cost</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.12%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">693</font></p>

  </td>

  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.38%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.66%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(5,790</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 1.5pt 0in;width:1.24%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">Net periodic
benefit cost of the Retirement Health Plan for the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2008, 2007 and 2006 include the following components.</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">Certain other
union employees are included in a multi-employer pension plan to which the
Company makes contributions in accordance with the union contract.&#160; Such contributions are made on a monthly
basis in accordance with the requirements of the union contract.&#160; Contributions to multi-employer pension plans
were $614,000, $558,000 and $537,000 for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008,
2007 and 2006, respectively.</font></i></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-42</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER
AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor
and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to
the Consolidated Financial Statements, continued</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">16.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Loss Per Share</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company accounts for earnings per share
in accordance with SFAS No.&nbsp;128, <i>Earnings per Share.</i>&#160; Basic net income (loss) per share is computed
by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted average number of common shares outstanding
during the periods presented.&#160; Diluted
net income per share reflects the potential dilution that could occur if
outstanding stock option and warrants were exercised.&#160; In addition, diluted convertible securities
are included in the denominator while interest on convertible debt, net of tax
and capitalized interest, is added back to the numerator.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the years ended March 31, 2008 and 2007, interest on the
convertible notes of $2,629,000 and $1,947,000, respectively, net of tax in
2007 and capitalized interest, and shares of 8,900,000 that would be issued
upon assumed conversion of the convertible notes, were excluded from the
calculation of diluted earnings per share because they were anti-dilutive.&#160; For the years ended March 31, 2008, 2007 and
2006, the common stock equivalents of the weighted average options, SARS, RSUs,
and warrants outstanding of 64,000, 830,000 and 1,884,000, respectively, were
excluded from the calculation of diluted earnings per share because they were
anti-dilutive.&#160; For the years ended March
31, 2008, 2007 and 2007, the weighted average options, SARs, and RSUs
outstanding of 2,533,000, 2,116,000 and 1,561,000, respectively, were excluded
from the calculation of diluted earnings per share because the exercise prices
were greater than the average market price of the common shares.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Concentration of Credit Risk</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company does not believe it is subject to any significant
concentration of credit risk relating to receivables.&#160; At March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007, 45.4% and
63.9% of the Company&#146;s receivables related to tickets sold to individual
passengers through the use of major credit cards, travel agencies approved by
the Airlines Reporting Corporation, tickets sold by other airlines and used by
passengers on Company flights, manufacturers&#146; credits and the Internal Revenue
Service.&#160; Receivables related to tickets
sold are short-term, generally being settled shortly after sale or in the month
following ticket usage.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-43</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-43',FILE='C:\JMS\105579\08-16762-3\task3011486\16762-3-ba-21.htm',USER='105579',CD='Jun 29 06:00 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER
AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor
and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to
the Consolidated Financial Statements, continued</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Commitments and Contingencies</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Legal Proceedings</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As discussed above, the Company filed voluntary petitions for reorganization
under Chapter&nbsp;11 of the United States Bankruptcy Code in the United States
Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of New York and their cases are
being jointly administered under Case No. 08-11298 (RDD). The Debtors continue
to operate their business as &#147;debtors-in-possession&#148; under the jurisdiction of
the Bankruptcy Court and in accordance with the applicable provisions of the
Bankruptcy Code and orders of the Bankruptcy Court. As of the date of the
Chapter&nbsp;11 filing, virtually all pending litigation was stayed, and absent
further order of the Bankruptcy Court, no party, subject to certain exceptions,
may take any action, also subject to certain exceptions, to recover on
pre-petition claims against the Debtors. At this time, it is not possible to
predict the outcome of the Chapter 11 cases or their effect on our business.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">From time to time, the Company is engaged in routine litigation
incidental to our business.&#160; The Company
believes there are no legal proceedings pending in which the Company is a party
or of which any of our property may be subject to that are not adequately
covered by insurance maintained by us, or which, if adversely decided, would
have a material adverse affect upon its business or financial condition.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Insurance</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2008,
the Company&#146;s services to and from Denver, Colorado were disrupted by two major
snowstorms that impacted the Company&#146;s service levels, revenues and operating
costs.&#160; The Company maintains business
interruption insurance to cover lost profits and received proceeds to recover
lost profits related to these events of $300,000.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007, the Company recorded insurance proceeds of
$868,000.&#160; These insurance proceeds were
a result of final settlements of business interruption claims that covered lost
profits when the Company&#146;s service to Cancun, Mexico and New Orleans, Louisiana
was disrupted by hurricanes during the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Purchase Commitments</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">As of March&nbsp;31,
2008, the Company has remaining firm purchase commitments for eight additional
aircraft and one spare Airbus engine, which have scheduled delivery dates
continuing through November&nbsp;2011<font face="Times New Roman">.&#160; The Company has not yet obtained financing
for any of the scheduled aircraft deliveries.&#160;
Under the terms of the purchase agreement, the Company is required to
make scheduled pre-delivery payments for these aircraft.&#160; These payments are non-refundable with certain
exceptions. As of March 31, 2008, the Company had made pre-delivery payments on
future deliveries totaling $12,738,000 to secure these aircraft purchases.</font></font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has aggregate additional amounts due under purchase
commitments and estimated amounts for buyer-furnished equipment, spare parts
for purchased aircraft and to equip the aircraft with LiveTV. </font><font face="Times New Roman">The Company is not under any contractual
obligations with respect to spare parts. </font>In addition, the
Company has commercial commitments under an agreement with SabreSonic<font face="Symbol">&#228;</font>
for its passenger reservations and check-in capabilities.&#160; The estimated aggregate amount for purchase
commitments is $374,044,000; $88,748,000 which is due in fiscal year 2008.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-44</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FRONTIER
AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Debtor
and Debtor-in-Possession as of April 10, 2008)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to
the Consolidated Financial Statements, continued</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Fuel Consortia</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company participates in numerous fuel
consortia with other carriers at major airports to reduce the costs of fuel
distribution and storage. Interline agreements govern the rights and
responsibilities of the consortia members and provide for the allocation of the
overall costs to operate the consortia based on usage. The consortia (and in
limited cases, the participating carriers) have entered into long-term
agreements to lease certain airport fuel storage and distribution facilities
that are typically financed through tax-exempt bonds (either special facilities
lease revenue bonds or general airport revenue bonds), issued by various local
municipalities. In general, each consortium lease agreement requires the
consortium to make lease payments in amounts sufficient to pay the maturing
principal and interest payments on the bonds. As of March&nbsp;31, 2008,
approximately $544,262,000 principal amount of such bonds were secured by fuel
facility leases at major hubs in which the Company participates, as to which
each of the signatory airlines has provided indirect guarantees of the debt.
The Company&#146;s exposure is approximately $23,811,000 principal amount of such
bonds based on our most recent consortia participation. The Company&#146;s exposure
could increase if the participation of other carriers decreases of if other
carriers default. The Company can exit all of their fuel consortia agreements
with limited penalties</font>  </font>and
certain advance notice requirements. The guarantees will expire when the
tax-exempt bonds are paid in full, which ranges from 2011 to 2033. The Company
has not recorded a liability on our consolidated balance sheets related to
these indirect guarantees.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Employees</font></i></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March&nbsp;31, 2008, the Company had 6,170 employees, of which
approximately 20% are represented by unions.&#160;
Of those employees covered by collective bargaining agreements, no
contracts are currently under negotiation or becoming amendable in fiscal year
2009.&#160; The Company believes that mutually
acceptable agreements can be reached with such employees, although the ultimate
outcome of the negotiations is unknown at this time.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Operating Segment Information</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SFAS&nbsp;No.&nbsp;131, &#147;Disclosures about
Segments of an Enterprise and Related Information,&#148; requires disclosures
related to components of a company for which separate financial information is
available that is evaluated regularly by a company&#146;s chief operating decision
maker in deciding the allocation of resources and assessing performance. The
Company has three primary operating and reporting segments, which consists of
mainline operations, Regional Partner operations, and Lynx Aviation
operations.&#160; Mainline operations include
service operated by Frontier using Airbus aircraft.&#160; Regional Partner operations include regional
jet service operated by Republic, Horizon and ExpressJet.&#160; Lynx Aviations operations, a subsidiary of
Frontier Holdings, includes service operated using Bombardier Q400 aircraft,
which began revenue flight service on December&nbsp;7, 2007.&#160; The Company evaluates segment performance
based on several factors, of which the primary financial measure is operating
income (loss). However, the Company does not manage the business or allocate
resources solely based on segment operating profit or loss, and scheduling
decisions of the Company&#146;s chief operating decision maker are based on their
contribution to the overall network.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 9.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.35pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To evaluate the separate
segments of the Company&#146;s operations, management has segregated the revenues
and costs of its operations as follows:&#160;
Passenger revenue for mainline, Regional Partners and Lynx Aviation
represents the revenue collected for flights operated by the Airbus fleet, the
aircraft under lease through contracts with Regional Partners and the
Bombardier Q400 fleet.&#160; Operating
expenses for Regional Partner flights include all direct costs associated with
the flights plus payments of performance bonuses if</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-45</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
